chunks.original_text: 寻真失路仙不遇而道不成，独处悲伤利不获而名不遂。 寅时二十三　晚既可望　中平 铁砚费研磨，淹留争奈何。 帆开秋涨阔，牛女渡银河。 功名未遂磨穿铁砚可为，时运未通用竭机关何益。 须待晚逢佳既秋色如春，达然老遇昌时衰年还壮。 寅时二十四　遇知见喜　上上 久久困泥沙，星金散作花。 借他良匠手，鼓舞出黄芽。 真金用於泥沙非陶镕则不能成器，美玉隐於顽石非琢磨则不能别真。 黄芽出土遇真仙，白壁生光逢良匠。 寅时二十五　作用通快　上上 青云年少功，壮气常凌空。 用事己得时，高飞出樊笼。 云梯高步蟾宫折桂之秋，旧意飞腾霄汉凌空之际。 通快者前程坦率去路迢遥，得时者济会方通情怀舒畅。 寅时二十六　事过空亡　下下 败北不堪论，山高日又昏。 马奔人失望，烟火一家村。 山高日暮乃怀忧抱虑之时，败北亡师乃挫锐失锋之意。 事不济则空劳志役马走人奔，道不行则馒设机谋烟消火灭。 寅时二十七　病患临身　下下 梦想更添愁，无情人更忧。 何时寻勿药，回首几经秋。 心多惑则梦想不宁，志多役则神思散乱。 孜孜之欲岂无坎坎之忧，戚戚之求必有绵绵之患。 寅时二十八　恬退可保　下下 安分方成泰，奔波必遇迍。 屈伸知有道，喜入笑眉颦。 安分者可以知止知足，恬养者可以保命保生。 静中守静亦可屈而亦可伸，迷中又迷必致迍而必致否。 寅时二十九　小有知音　中平 庭外已虚心，忽闻鸾凤音。 断金知有意，当认伯牙琴。 虚其心者殊无萦惑之忧，闻其音者知有鸾凤之瑞。 断金者逢议让之华风，调琴者遇知音之交友。 寅时三十　功名际会　上上 朝游荷花湖，夕上凌烟阁。 壮志歌此行，马蹄侵日角。 道德就则游宴十洲主岛，功行满则逍遥四海五湖。 勋业俱盈名可标於凌烟，壮志峥嵘身可攀於麟凤。 卯时第一　劳心有望　上上 羊肠危百结，世路实多艰，禄马相逢处，云霄可自攀。 事多过虑心万端而肠百结，世路艰辛道未亨而力寡助。 先历风霜之险阻得意勿骄，次逢禄马之扶持称心勿慢。 卯时第二　再求有望　中平 重整乱线头，新修急峡舟。 若逢春后泽，花柳一时抽。 路头未达一重水过一重山，谋用未成乱丝头续乱丝尾。 弊损之舟再整可济瞿塘，甘膏之泽复还霈新花柳。 卯时第三　事防重迭　中平 心绪乱如麻，浪看花后花。 何时勤拂拭，回者故人家。 纷纷之扰一事去而一事来，衮衮之波一浪退而一浪进。 拂拭者辟除外事小吝自消，回首者改悔前非大虞自息。 卯时第四　事多障碍　下下 白头人未老，多苦更枯肠，逢处皆荆棘，何时忧自忘。 人犹未老先言白首之悲，事已凋残谩起枯肠之叹。 当道有荆榛之碍进步不前，去路生颠覆之危奔趋不遂。 卯时第五　望用称心　上上 有意出机先，相逢不偶然。 职名皆得地，花锦到平川。 筹画之机用在前而成在后，职禄之事向则吉而趋则亨。 得地者景既如花如锦，相逢者绿契非偶非然。 卯时第六　家道吉昌　上上 桃李照门庭，溪山远屋青。 天香凝不断，风物逐时新。 春色芳浓桃李有芳菲之景，秋光明净溪山无埃昧之尘。 天香一热散兰摩之氤氲，风物初新保家门之福庆。 卯时第七　欺昧不明　下下 玉石已难分，奸邪不可论。 怨从阴毒起，蛇鼠自相吞。
chunks.translated_text:
**Seeking the Dao, Losing the Path – Immortals Unmet, the Way Unfulfilled**
Alone in sorrow, profit ungrasped, fame unattained.

**Twenty-Third Oracle of the Hour of Yin – Late Success Yet Hopeful – Neutral**
The iron inkstone wears thin from grinding—
What can one do but linger in delay?
Sails unfurl on autumn’s swelling tide,
As the Herd-Boy and Weaver-Girl cross the Silver River.

Ambitions unmet, the iron inkstone may yet be worn through;
Fortune unturned, schemes exhausted bring no gain.
Wait for late success—autumn’s hues like spring’s return—
In time, even the aged may thrive, the withered grow strong.

**Twenty-Fourth Oracle of the Hour of Yin – Meeting Knowledge, Joy Arises – Most Auspicious**
Long mired in mud and sand,
Star-gold scatters into blossoms.
By the hand of a master craftsman,
It dances forth as the Yellow Sprout.

True gold buried in mud and sand cannot be shaped without refining;
Fine jade hidden in rough stone cannot be revealed without polishing.
The Yellow Sprout emerges from the earth, meeting a true immortal;
White jade gleams, encountering a skilled artisan.

**Twenty-Fifth Oracle of the Hour of Yin – Action Flows Freely – Most Auspicious**
Youth soars on azure clouds,
Vigorous qi ever ascends the void.
Timing now in hand,
One flies high, escaping the cage.

A cloud-laddered climb to pluck osmanthus in the Moon Palace;
Long-held aspirations take flight through the heavens.
For the unobstructed, the path ahead lies open, the journey far;
For those in tune with the times, all flows smoothly, the heart at ease.

**Twenty-Sixth Oracle of the Hour of Yin – Affairs Pass, Void and Perished – Most Inauspicious**
Defeat cannot bear recounting—
Mountains loom, the sun dims.
The horse bolts, hope lost—
Only a wisp of smoke from a lone village.

Mountains high, the sun setting—time for sorrow and care;
Defeat in retreat—momentum broken, edge lost.
Affairs unfulfilled bring vain toil, horses bolt, men flee;
The Dao unmanifest, schemes dissolve like smoke, fires fade.

**Twenty-Seventh Oracle of the Hour of Yin – Illness Befalls the Body – Most Inauspicious**
Dreams breed deeper sorrow,
Heartless ones grow more troubled.
When will one seek the healing herb?
Turning back, how many autumns have passed?

A mind beset by confusion finds no peace in dreams;
A spirit taxed by striving scatters in disarray.
Endless desires bring inevitable stumbles and woes;
Relentless pursuits must yield unending afflictions.

**Twenty-Eighth Oracle of the Hour of Yin – Contentment Preserves Peace – Inauspicious**
Knowing one’s place brings tranquility;
Restless striving courts misfortune.
To bend or stretch—know the Dao,
And joy will crease the brow in laughter.

Those content know when to stop, when to be satisfied;
Those serene preserve life and destiny.
In stillness, stillness may bend or stretch;
In delusion, delusion leads to stagnation and decline.

**Twenty-Ninth Oracle of the Hour of Yin – A Small Circle of Kindred Spirits – Neutral**
Beyond the courtyard, the heart lies empty—
Suddenly, the cry of phoenix and simurgh.
Cutting gold, one knows the intent;
Recognize the zither of Bo Ya.

An empty heart holds no entangling worries;
Hearing the cry, one knows the auspice of phoenix and simurgh.
Cutting gold, one meets the elegance of yielding counsel;
Tuning the zither, one finds a friend of true understanding.

**Thirtieth Oracle of the Hour of Yin – Achievement and Recognition – Most Auspicious**
Morning strolls by the lotus lake,
Evening ascends the Tower of Lingyan.
With bold resolve, one sings of this journey—
The horse’s hooves press close to the sun’s corner.

Virtue perfected, one roams the ten isles and master peaks;
Merit complete, one wanders freely through the four seas and five lakes.
Deeds and honors both fulfilled, one’s name may grace the Tower of Lingyan;
Lofty aspirations soar—one’s person may ascend with the qilin and phoenix.

**First Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Toil with Hope – Most Auspicious**
The sheep’s gut path fraught with knots,
The world’s road truly steep and harsh.
Where fortune and steed converge,
One may climb the clouds and skies.

Affairs breed overthinking, the heart a tangle of a hundred knots;
The world’s path is arduous, the Dao unyielding, strength scarce.
First endure the perils of wind and frost—do not grow proud in success;
Next, meet the support of fortune and steed—do not slacken in contentment.

**Second Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Renewed Pursuit, Hopeful – Neutral**
Reordering the tangled threads,
Repairing the battered boat for the swift gorge.
If one meets spring’s bounty,
Flowers and willows burst forth at once.

The path ahead unclear—one river crossed, another mountain looms;
Plans unfulfilled—tangled threads lead to more tangled ends.
A damaged boat, once mended, may yet cross the Qutang Gorge;
Sweet rains return, renewing flowers and willows.

**Third Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Beware Repeated Troubles – Neutral**
The heart’s threads tangled as hemp,
Waves upon waves of blossoms.
When will one diligently sweep and polish,
To return to the old friend’s home?

A flurry of disturbances—one affair departs, another arrives;
Endless waves—one recedes, another surges.
To sweep and polish is to clear away trivial vexations, small grudges fade;
To turn back is to repent past wrongs, great anxieties cease.

**Fourth Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Many Obstacles – Most Inauspicious**
The white-haired one not yet old,
Yet much suffering dries the bowels.
Everywhere thorns and brambles—
When will sorrow be forgotten?

One not yet old speaks of the sorrow of white hair;
Affairs already withered spur vain sighs of dried bowels.
The path ahead blocked by thorns and thickets—no forward progress;
The road behind fraught with peril—no swift escape.

**Fifth Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Hopes Fulfilled – Most Auspicious**
Intent on seizing the moment,
The meeting not by chance.
Office and rank both well-placed,
Flowers and brocade reach the plain.

Plans laid in advance bear fruit later;
Office and fortune favor those who act—auspicious and smooth.
Well-placed, the scene unfolds like flowers and brocade;
The meeting is no accident, no mere coincidence.

**Sixth Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Family Prosperity – Most Auspicious**
Peach and plum grace the courtyard,
Streams and mountains frame the distant house in green.
Heavenly fragrance lingers unbroken,
The landscape renews with the seasons.

Spring’s lush hues—peach and plum in fragrant bloom;
Autumn’s clear light—streams and mountains free of dust.
Heavenly fragrance, once kindled, scatters the mist of orchids;
The landscape, ever new, safeguards the family’s blessings.

**Seventh Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Deceit and Ignorance – Most Inauspicious**
Jade and stone hard to distinguish,
Treachery and deceit beyond discussion.
Resentment arises from hidden malice—
Snakes and rats devour one another.

Jade and stone indistinguishable;
Treachery and deceit defy reason.
Grudges born of dark poison;
Snakes and rats turn on their own kind.

chunks.original_text: 佞人谗已虽明哲不能保其身，阴贼害人纵贤智不能免其毒。 美玉顽石真伪尚未可分，君子小人邪正犹未可识。 卯时第八　资助有得　上上 去去莫迟回，天边步斗魁。 一嘘吞巨浪，走马借声雷。 去路坦然勿举迟回之意，来祥助顺必昭星斗之光。 巨浪兴因风力而吹嘘，密云起得雷音之声势。 卯时第九　事多虚诈　下下 有口只谈空，无情强不同。 笑他人兽面，翻覆雨云中。 伪谈饰说听之者其巧如簧，诈语虚词味之者其甘如蜜。 轻信寡诺秪知表而不知中，人面兽心朝生喜而暮生怒。 卯时第十　事遂功成　上上 九转就丹砂，平吞日月华。 真如龙虎妙，天地一黄芽。 金丹妙药无非九转之功，富寿康宁乃是五行纯粹。 天非云障日月现於光辉，人有道心龙虎聚而钦伏。 卯时十一　道果圆成　上上 仙骨比乔松，灵丹认葛洪。 鹤声云外急，人在碧霄中。 道骨仙风可比乔松之盛，龟龄鹤算可同盘石之安。 功行满得为云外仙宾，道果圆堪作蓬壶羽客。 卯时十二　安分有成　上上 樽酒惹闲狂，谁家蝶梦忙。 惺惺当自觉，秋后更时长。 损真乱性有如毕卓贪杯，迷意惑情全似庄周梦蝶。 惺惺者宜早有觉晓岸清风，贤长者安分知机暮天月朗。 卯时十三　人离财散　下下 魂梦逐云飞，行人归未归。 马奔人亦走，空有泪沾衣。 云飞天外梦魂散以无踪，鸥泛波中人财离而尽失。 马牛奔而驾驭不止。 事亦难追，涕相流而悲感自生情亦难爽。 卯时十四　家宅多凶　下下 不觉断蛇伤，鹰飞难整行。 乌啼春雨后，人在日中忙。 雁失行手足不利兄弟乖离，蛇伤断骨肉有忧夫妇刑克。 乌啼雨后空嗟满目，花残人在日中自觉一身影乱。 卯时十五　神明扶佑　上上 事业谁无报，阴功信有神。 飞腾今有路，一举谢埃尘。 施阴德者必招阳报，行善事者必感福临。 上可以超宗拔祖吉庆所以流传，下可以瘾子荣孙神明所以扶佑。 卯时十六　望外有信　上上 燕子落天边，行行马信传。 未期心外事，红绿已联翩。 春光淡荡燕传熙喜之音，秋色澄清雁报佳祥之信。 望行人忽然而至花绽娇红，占用事坦然而成柳敷阴绿。 卯时十七　先滞后快　中平 雨脚暗山前，行人出未还。 待他风力卷，明月照红颜。 雨意浓而山路险，行人阻而音信稀。 渐次雨散云收便觉舒情而快爽，须臾风清月白始知发笑以开颜。 卯时十八　人财不宁　下下 闲虑苦骎骎，惊波逐此心。 无言空抱恨，人鬼怒相侵。 忧疑不庾者谓之虑，其虑惶惶暴乱忽至者谓之惊。 其惊扰扰心绪不遂则抱恨，无言人事不和黝阴鬼谋害。 卯时十九　前程通快　上上 柳阴方濯濯，松干已峨峨。 着意春无尽，东南兴最多。 竹身松干不忧霜雪之侵凌，槐影柳阴正遇清和之景色。 幸有束君之着意朽壤须荣，不妨朱夏之熙游情怀必遂。 卯时二十　得人扶助　上上 中流似失船，赖得一壶全。 更加风济岸，轮月照青天。 船至中流有失死在须臾，赖得有人救援生於倾刻。 顺风济岸心始宁而事始安，红日升天昏得明而暗复朗。 卯时二十一　前程得地　上上 情通濯锦川，帝里又开莲。 尽是超腾地，披云望九天。 情通道泰玩观锦绣之山川，功遂名超荣耀王都之帝里。 飞黄腾踏心不顾於蟾蜍，云雾披天身可乘於鸾鹤。 卯时二十二　事多乖悮　下下
chunks.translated_text:
**Eighth Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Aid Received – Most Auspicious**
Go forth without delay,
Step the Dipper’s path at heaven’s edge.
A single breath swallows the towering wave,
A galloping steed borrows the thunder’s roar.

The road ahead lies smooth—cast not the thought of hesitation;
Auspicious signs assist, revealing the radiance of stars and constellations.
The giant wave rises by the wind’s forceful breath,
Dense clouds gather, attaining the thunder’s mighty sound.

**Ninth Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Deceit and Falsehood – Most Inauspicious**
Mouths speak only empty words,
Cold hearts feign agreement.
Mocking others’ beastly faces,
They shift like rain and clouds.

False speech adorned with artifice—listeners find it sweet as reed pipes;
Deceitful words, hollow phrases—tastes like honey to the unwary.
Trusting lightly, keeping few promises, they know only surfaces, not depths;
Human faces, beastly hearts—joy in the morning, rage by dusk.

**Tenth Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Success Achieved – Most Auspicious**
Nine refinements perfect the cinnabar,
Swallowing whole the sun and moon’s splendor.
True as the dragon and tiger’s mystery,
Heaven and earth unite in a single sprout.

The elixir’s wondrous medicine lies in ninefold refinement;
Wealth, longevity, and well-being arise from the Five Phases’ purity.
When clouds part, the sun and moon shine in full brilliance;
With the Dao in one’s heart, dragons and tigers gather in reverence.

**Eleventh Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Dao-Fruit Fully Realized – Most Auspicious**
Immortal bones rival the towering pine,
Divine elixir recognized by Ge Hong.
Crane cries hasten beyond the clouds,
One dwells amid the azure heavens.

Dao-bones and immortal bearing compare to the pine’s vigor;
Tortoise years and crane longevity match the bedrock’s steadfastness.
Merit and practice fulfilled, one becomes a celestial guest beyond the clouds;
The Dao-fruit perfected, one may dwell as an immortal of Penglai.

**Twelfth Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Contentment Brings Success – Most Auspicious**
Wine cups stir idle madness—
Whose home knows the butterfly’s frantic dream?
Awake, one must rouse oneself;
After autumn, time stretches long.

Harming truth, disordering nature—like Bi Zhu’s drunken greed;
Bewildering the mind, confusing emotions—like Zhuang Zhou’s butterfly dream.
The wakeful should early attain clarity, as the dawn breeze clears the shore;
The wise and virtuous, content in their lot, know the evening moon’s brightness.

**Thirteenth Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Separation and Loss – Most Inauspicious**
Soul and dream chase clouds in flight,
The traveler has not yet returned.
Horses bolt, people flee—
Only tears stain the robes.

Clouds drift beyond the sky, dream-spirits scatter without trace;
Gulls float on the waves, people and wealth part, all lost.
Horses and oxen bolt, their harnesses unchecked—
Matters cannot be retrieved; tears flow, sorrow arises, grief cannot be dispelled.

**Fourteenth Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Household Misfortune – Most Inauspicious**
Unaware, a severed snake brings harm,
Hawks take flight, ranks scatter.
Crows cry after spring rain,
People toil beneath the sun’s glare.

Geese lose their formation—hands and feet falter, brothers turn against one another;
Snakes sever limbs—flesh and bone suffer, husbands and wives clash.
Crows cry after rain—vain sighs fill the eyes;
Flowers wither, people toil in the sun, sensing only chaos within.

**Fifteenth Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Divine Protection – Most Auspicious**
No deed goes unrewarded,
Hidden virtue assuredly moves the gods.
A path to soar now opens—
With one leap, leave the dust behind.

Those who bestow hidden virtue will surely receive bright recompense;
Those who perform good deeds will surely feel blessings descend.
Above, one may exalt ancestors and uplift descendants—fortune thus flows;
Below, one may bless children and grandchildren—divine protection thus abides.

**Sixteenth Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Unexpected News – Most Auspicious**
Swallows alight at heaven’s edge,
Step by step, the horse’s tidings arrive.
Unforeseen matters beyond hope—
Red and green unfold in succession.

Spring’s gentle light carries swallows’ joyful news;
Autumn’s clarity bears geese’s auspicious tidings.
The longed-for traveler arrives unexpectedly—flowers bloom in vivid red;
Matters proceed smoothly—willows spread their verdant shade.

**Seventeenth Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Delay Followed by Ease – Neutral**
Rain trails darken the mountain’s face,
The traveler departs but has not returned.
Wait for the wind’s force to gather—
The bright moon will illuminate rosy cheeks.

Rain thickens, mountain paths grow perilous;
The traveler is hindered, word scarce.
Gradually, rain scatters, clouds disperse—ease and delight arise;
Soon, wind clears, moon brightens—smiles break forth, faces lighten.

**Eighteenth Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Restlessness and Loss – Most Inauspicious**
Idle worries press urgently,
Shocking waves pursue this heart.
Speechless, one clutches resentment—
Ghosts and men rage in assault.

Endless fretting is called anxiety;
Sudden, violent turmoil is called shock.
Shock disrupts the heart’s peace—resentment takes hold;
Silent, human affairs turn hostile, dark ghosts scheme harm.

**Nineteenth Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Smooth Progress Ahead – Most Auspicious**
Willow shade just fresh and lush,
Pine trunks already towering.
With intent, spring knows no end—
The southeast holds the greatest promise.

Bamboo stalks and pine trunks fear not frost and snow’s assault;
Scholartree shade and willow boughs meet the season’s gentle warmth.
Fortunately, the lord’s intent revives the withered and decayed;
No harm in summer’s radiant wanderings—joyful aspirations will be fulfilled.

**Twentieth Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Assistance Received – Most Auspicious**
Midstream, the boat seems lost—
Relying on a single gourd, it is saved.
With the wind’s aid, it reaches shore—
The wheeling moon illuminates the blue heavens.

The boat, adrift midstream, faces imminent ruin;
Thanks to another’s rescue, life is restored in an instant.
With favorable winds, the shore is reached—peace returns, affairs stabilize;
The red sun ascends the sky—darkness yields to brightness once more.

**Twenty-First Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Favorable Prospects – Most Auspicious**
Affection flows through the River of Brocade,
In the imperial city, lotuses bloom anew.
All is ground for ascent—
Parting clouds, gaze upon the nine heavens.

Affection harmonious, the Dao flourishes—behold the embroidered rivers and mountains;
Merit achieved, fame soars—glory shines in the imperial capital.
Soaring on winged steeds, the heart heeds not the toad in the moon;
Clouds part, the body may ride upon phoenix and crane.

**Twenty-Second Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Discord and Error – Most Inauspicious**

chunks.original_text: 平地障云山，朦胧不可攀。 怨多空掩袖，咫尺隔云间。 云山迭迭始知途路之逼，月影朦胧难折广寒之桂。 积怨多人怀恨毒举措堤防。 契分浅事系乖讹行藏颠错。 卯时二十三　小疑有成　中平 红雨湿桃腮，离情莫怨猜。 春风如有待，生意又重开。 桃腮杏脸不禁骤雨狂风，娇意虚情不必怨猜离恨。 春风至芳萌再发释去闲疑，小用成欣笑重开驱除念虑。 卯时二十四　事无定准　下下 身似一浮呕，随风柳絮游。 波澜犹未止，何处觅踪由。 一身有似浮沤忽尔生而忽尔灭，万事有如飞絮或时聚而或时飞。 进望如木上出没之沤，谋事若风中颠狂之絮。 卯时二十五　必获异宠　上上 呜鹤在前途，鸳鸯叩玉壶。 天厨应自设，忻得贵人扶。 鸾鹤飞呜已遂逍遥之志，鸳鸯对偶相期宠爱之欢。 天厨设上品之珍羞，贵人扶阴德之相助。 卯时二十六　庾策必胜　上上 筹策孰为先，人才第一贤。 宠奇当未艾，千里独加鞭。 机略之妙谓之筹知鬼神之情状，料度无义谓之策庾胜负於有无。 二事俱备取胜之道不难，千里加鞭立功之宜必易。 卯时二十七　口舌相凌　下下 言行两相违，空论是与非。 不知荣与辱，轻在发枢机。
chunks.translated_text:
**Twenty-Third Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Minor Doubts Yield Success – Neutral**

Flat ground rises as clouded mountains,
Veil upon veil—no path to climb.
Resentments mount, sleeves hide empty tears;
A foot’s distance spans clouded skies.

Clouded peaks layer upon layer—only then is the road’s constraint known;
Moonlight dims, the osmanthus of Guanghan hard to pluck.
Resentments accumulate, many harbor venomous grudges—take heed in action;
Shallow bonds, affairs entangled—conduct and concealment both awry.

**Twenty-Fourth Oracle of the Hour of Mao – No Fixed Course – Most Inauspicious**

A body like a floating bubble,
Drifting with the wind like willow fluff.
Waves yet unsettled—
Where to seek trace or reason?

This body resembles a fleeting bubble, now born, now gone;
All affairs are like windblown catkins, now gathered, now scattered.
Hopes rise and fall like bubbles on water;
Plans shift like floss in the storm.

**Twenty-Fifth Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Certain to Gain Exceptional Favor – Most Auspicious**

Cranes cry along the way ahead,
Mandarin ducks knock at the jade pot.
Heaven’s kitchen sets its feast—
Joy in the noble’s support.

Phoenix and crane take flight, carefree aspirations fulfilled;
Mandarin ducks pair in expectation of favored delight.
Heaven’s kitchen arrays its finest delicacies;
The noble lends aid, virtue’s hidden grace.

**Twenty-Sixth Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Strategies Assured of Victory – Most Auspicious**

Which strategy takes precedence?
Talent is foremost in worth.
Favor and marvel yet unwaning—
A thousand leagues spurred on alone.

The subtlety of schemes is called *chou*—knowing the minds of gods and spirits;
The art of calculation is called *ce*—victory or defeat in grasp or lack.
With both in place, triumph comes easily;
A thousand leagues spurred—merit’s path lies open.

**Twenty-Seventh Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Verbal Hostilities – Most Inauspicious**

Words and deeds at odds,
Empty debates of right and wrong.
Unknowing of honor or disgrace—
Lightly the trigger is sprung.

chunks.original_text: 宫行相合者谓之君子，言行相违者谓之小人。 毁真乱正逢天诛地戮之愆尤，反是作非遭杖舌耕犁之果报。 卯时二十八　所求可望　中平 行意莫迟回，重添别后杯。 莫忧人影瘦，庭月照江梅。 意思迟回多是累逢屯挫，重添杯酒岂非断续欢忻。 人影清瘦必然先见於忧怀，月照寒梅乃是晚逢於佳贶。 卯时二十九　喜庆有渐　上上 缺月未圆时，看看桂子垂。 马蹄虽未快，喜笑入双眉。 新月初生渐有团圆之影，马蹄缓步岂无驰骤之心。 占名位从小至大恩既重重，占财禄从窄至宽欢情迭迭。 卯时三十　骨肉离散　下下 孤雁失无群，一辰呜不可闻。 望伊伊不见，辽邈几重云。 雁失群夫妇有丧偶之悲，声哀呜兄弟有别离之叹。 占骨肉者则主生离死别，谋动用者则有惹患招殃。 玄真灵应宝签卷上竟 ＃１『求名取禄遇荐举而进身』，签文字数多为对称，故疑此句脱一字。 ＃２『目』原作『日』，疑误，据上下文义改。 玄真灵应宝签卷中 辰时第一　天赐福佑　上上 天外散浮云，真仙降玉音。 福华并禄算，忻喜此门庭。 浮云散则天气朗而地气清，真仙集则家道昌而公道泰。 施恩布德自然禄算之锦长，奉道敬真必尔福华之延永。 辰时第二　幽失不前　下下 天外起浮云，月华那更明。 行人山路崄，不可复登程。 浮云障月掩桂魄以无光，险路登程阻行人而失路。 心所急急而不济所以进不可前，事有阻阻而未通所以退不可后。 辰时第三　人情见阻　下下 玉石共沉埋，贤愚不并裁。 是非俱一体，岂得共和谐。 至宝至美者谓之玉，至顽至硬者谓之石。 有才有德者谓之贤，无才无德者谓之愚，既是非真伪之不分，必人事乖讹而见阻。 辰时第四　德意成庆　上上 独步上云霄，前程万里迢。 更无他阻障，鸾鹤自逍逼。 耿耿云霄则与尘泥之隔远，迢迢万里始知前路之遥长。 无阻障者知其意而自然，得逍遥者得其乐而成庆。 辰时第五　如愿遂心　上上 万宝已成秋，欢声到风楼。 好将香火愿，共答百神麻。 百谷丰登万宝收成之际，千祥庆集一天和气之时。 香火殷葱者则福力愈重愈高，诚意坚确者则欢情愈安愈遂。 辰时第六　平和遂利　上上 春色满仙园，风和花正妍。 赏心无一事，举措合神天。 和风丽日则草木秀而芳华，乐事赏心则念虑消而悦择。 物遇春虽朽坏亦可扶而敷荣，人有道求名利亦自然而超遂。 辰时第七　先忧后喜　中平 风浪急孤舟，心中未遂游。 彼岸人接力，方始得安周。 风狂浪急出於不测之中，旅泊舟孤正在惊惶之际。 神物护无虞无害心渐平宁，人力接乃助乃安事方获泰。 辰时第八　进退不安　下下 碎事恼心怀，人情两未谐。 欲将心下事，进退又讹乖。 凡事无巨无细有所感者则恼心怀，凡人求进求通无所就者必损於志。 恼损心怀者谓之不安，徒劳进退者谓之不遂。 辰时第九　退保守吉　中平 月落五更残，家人独掩关。 徘徊那有遂，仍旧守吾庵。 西倾月落始知更漏之残，独坐掩关自觉无聊之既。 降寸心而屏息思虑外事休干，守大道而颐养神形内衷不扰。 辰时第十　殊祥佑吉　上上 洞庭秋色满，明月照波澜。 好趁扁舟去，蓬觅大舟。 洞庭秋夜之月色浩渺波澜，蓬莱丽日之春光熙和宇宙。 扁舟顺济风不动而浪不生，大丹炼成神可升而仙可遇。
chunks.translated_text:
**Twenty-Eighth Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Hopes Within Reach – Neutral**

The steadfast hesitate no more,
Another cup to toast parting’s shore.
Fret not the shadow’s thinning frame—
The courtyard moon illumines winter’s plum’s acclaim.

Hesitation and delay often meet with setbacks’ chain;
Another cup of wine may yet rekindle joy’s refrain.
A shadow’s frailty first appears in sorrow’s weight;
The moon on frosted plum arrives as fortune’s late delight.

**Twenty-Ninth Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Joy’s Gradual Blossoming – Most Auspicious**

The crescent moon not yet full,
Behold the osmanthus’ pendent pull.
Though the steed’s hooves move not swift,
Laughter and smiles the brows uplift.

The new moon’s birth foretells reunion’s trace;
A horse’s slow step hides a gallop’s pace.
For rank and title, from small to great, favor unfolds in layers deep;
For wealth and emolument, from narrow to wide, joy’s tide runs steep.

**Thirtieth Oracle of the Hour of Mao – Kin Scattered – Most Inauspicious**

A lone goose loses its flock,
A single cry—none answer’s shock.
Gazing for one now gone from sight,
How many clouds stretch o’er the height?

The goose bereft of flock foretells a spouse’s grief;
Its mournful cry bespeaks a sibling’s parting brief.
For kin, it portends life’s sundering or death’s divide;
For schemes and deeds, it warns of woes and strife untried.

*End of the Upper Scroll of the Precious Oracle of Mystic Truth and Numinous Response*

---

**First Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Heaven’s Blessing Bestowed – Most Auspicious**

Beyond the heavens, drifting clouds disperse,
True immortals descend with jade-toned verse.
Fortune and splendor, fate’s rich thread,
Joy fills this house and hearth instead.

When floating clouds disperse, heaven’s breath grows bright, earth’s qi serene;
When true immortals gather, the household thrives, the public weal is seen.
Bestowing grace and virtue, one’s fate unfurls like brocade’s sheen;
Revering the Dao and honoring truth, blessings stretch long and serene.

**Second Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Obstructed in Seclusion – Most Inauspicious**

Beyond the heavens, clouds arise,
The moon’s radiance dims, its light denied.
A traveler on a mountain path so steep,
No further step—his journey’s sleep.

Floating clouds veil the moon, its osmanthus glow eclipsed, bereft of light;
A treacherous path thwarts the traveler, his way lost in the night.
Matters urgent yet unmet—forward progress barred;
Affairs obstructed, unresolved—retreat is marred.

**Third Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Human Relations Thwarted – Most Inauspicious**

Jade and stone lie buried deep,
Worthy and foolish none may keep.
Right and wrong as one appear,
How can harmony hold here?

The purest treasure, the fairest gem is jade;
The coarsest, hardest stone is but its shade.
The worthy bear both talent and virtue’s glow;
The foolish lack both—fit for naught they show.
Since truth and falsehood blur, distinctions fade,
Human affairs in discord’s grip are laid.

**Fourth Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Virtue’s Intent Brings Celebration – Most Auspicious**

Alone I tread the clouded height,
A journey vast, ten thousand li in sight.
No barrier stands in the way,
Phoenix and crane in freedom sway.

Through boundless clouds, far from the dust’s embrace,
Ten thousand li reveal the path’s vast space.
Unobstructed, the heart’s intent finds its way;
In carefree joy, celebration holds sway.

**Fifth Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Wishes Fulfilled – Most Auspicious**

A thousand treasures ripe in autumn’s glow,
Joy’s echoes reach the wind-swept tower’s brow.
With fragrant incense and devout prayer,
A hundred gods their blessings share.

As myriad grains mature and treasures yield,
A thousand blessings gather, heaven’s harmony revealed.
With fervent incense, virtue’s weight grows deep;
With steadfast faith, joy’s peace runs sure and steep.

**Sixth Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Harmony and Success – Most Auspicious**

Spring’s hues fill the immortal’s garden fair,
The breeze is mild, the blossoms bright and rare.
A heart at ease, no cares to bear,
Each act aligns with heaven’s care.

Gentle winds and radiant sun make grasses lush and flowers bright;
Joyful moments ease the mind, dissolving every plight.
Though things in spring may seem withered or decayed,
With the Dao’s aid, success in name and gain is naturally made.

**Seventh Oracle of the Hour of Chen – First Sorrow, Then Joy – Neutral**

A lone boat in the tempest’s grip,
The heart’s desire yet unmet’s trip.
But hands reach from the distant shore,
At last, all troubles are no more.

Fierce winds and towering waves arise from unseen deep;
A solitary boat drifts, its passenger in dread’s steep keep.
Yet with divine protection, harm is stayed, the heart finds peace;
With aid from others, safety comes, and strife must cease.

**Eighth Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Advance and Retreat Unsettled – Most Inauspicious**

Trifles vex the heart’s repose,
Human ties in discord close.
Hopes once cherished, now askew,
Advance and retreat both fail to do.

No matter great or small, affairs that stir the breast
Leave those who seek success or passage sore oppressed.
A troubled heart finds no repose;
Futile efforts bring no close.

**Ninth Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Retreat Ensures Good Fortune – Neutral**

The moon sinks at the fifth watch’s end,
The household shuts its gate, alone to fend.
Pacing, no progress made,
Return to guard my hermitage’s shade.

As the moon dips west, the night’s last watch is spent;
Alone behind closed doors, ennui’s weight is felt.
Calm the heart, still thoughts of worldly strife;
Guard the Dao, nurture spirit and form in tranquil life.

**Tenth Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Auspicious Omens Bestow Blessing – Most Auspicious**

Autumn’s hues fill Dongting’s expanse,
The bright moon gilds the rippling dance.
Take the skiff and swiftly go,
Seek Penglai’s isle where treasures glow.

Dongting’s autumn night, the moon’s vast light on waves does play;
Penglai’s radiant spring, the cosmos in warmth holds sway.
A skiff glides smooth, the wind still, waves at rest;
The great elixir wrought, immortals may be blessed.

*Beginning of the Middle Scroll of the Precious Oracle of Mystic Truth and Numinous Response*

chunks.original_text: 辰时十一　事因不快　中平 落叶满庭除，西风扫夜居。 幽人情不快，余困岂能苏。 心疲志困对西风着物之悲，事拙谋乖起落叶辞柯之叹，欲弃之弃而不能食鸡玩助，欲求之求而不得指雁为羹。 辰时十二　求望未遂　下下 星月现微明，光华事未分。 亭阑人去速，心事恼精神。 新月初生未见团圆之桂影，寸心未遂尚多颠错之乖情。 故人去速则怀离别之悲忧，事绪恼心则见艰难之阻遏。 辰时十三　淹滞方苏　上上 枯木再逢春，芳菲满自明。 与君同庆赏，遂得逐时新。 在根之木得春风则叶茂柯荣，有道之人遇命亨则名超位达。 虽脱淹延之滞道德重修，幸逢昌泰之时芳菲共赏。 辰时十四　灾退病除　中平 久困外沉痾，忧情甚被魔。 忽然良药遇，轻举上云罗。 绵绵困滞浑如久外於沉痾，迭迭忧怀何异困居於幽壑。 忽遇良剂病可退而疾可痊，得济高人出乎类而拔乎萃。 辰时十五　往凶退吉　下下 孤客夜登程，云昏月色沉。 秪堪恨寥落，回首竟无凭。 孤客登程夜已昏而月已落，蹇人用事志已拙而谋已＋疏。 寥落者往则有不测之虞，回首者退则少保安之福。 辰时十六　前程进达　上上 文章得意归，恩沛赐诽衣。 光华修显赫，福禄自相依。 得意文场取功名如俯地拾芥，进身台省被恩华如仰天太阳。 道德隆而嗣禄超荣，福禄依而门庭显赫。 辰时十七　内外不宁　下下 默默坐空堂，愁心未展张。 那堪人鬼路，家宅事忙忙。 内不宁因家道不和，外不宁因人事不顺。 情怀郁结人鬼怨嗟愁心默，默幽怨多扰事凄凄欢乐少。 辰时十八　平安凝福　上上 清晨一灶香，天意保安康，举心皈大道，福庆自然长。 晨香至梼祈门户之平安，夙夜无欺保千龄而益美。 行一善则百神协助集福凝祥，喊一恶则万祸蠲除宥愆赦过。 辰时十九　心远事迟　中平 万斛沉舟发，波津尚满凝。 空存千里志，未得一篙轻。 船阁浅滩不可棹而不可惊，事逢忧滞不可奉而不可通。 志怀千里移寸步而尚阻尚难，心有百端设机关而何施何用。 辰时二十　意诚两乖　下下 童蒙未解机，昏识岂堪为。 且守存余意，终成白首归。 童蒙之子智识昧於奇才，愚暗之人器量浅於大用。 失机会者功摧名堕白首无成，大痴迷者事拙谋乖惶颜何济。 辰时二十一　闻忧不忧　中平 人倚在西楼，秋深笛韵幽。 秪堪空自看，不必更怀愁。 人怀愁感闻笛韵而生悲，事系忧心听雁声而起虑。 释其忧感则悲变为欢，安其心神则虑变为庆。 辰时二十二　闻喜不喜　中平 一雁空传信，虚声不见声。 笑言忧喜事，但且枉传闻。 所闻者妄传喜信喜自何生，所见者惟是空花空则无实。 徒起矜夸之美誉一事无成，空成懊恼之悲惭寸心有恨。 辰时二十三　福至灾释　上上 道德助良缘，天书降宝轩。 许多灾厄虑，一扫更无愆。 人有三灾八难自作孽者不可活，命有四柱五行自知分者必无挠。 □害除吉祥自至红日消冰，愆尤散福庆自生暴风飘叶。 辰时二十四　待时有庆　中平 有玉隐昆山，光芒射斗寒。 若逢良匠别，传器在人间。 人怀道德如隐玉於石中，命遇亨通似仙脱於凡壳。 道德仁义人之宝可圣可贤，金玉珍珠世之珍乃富乃贵。 辰时二十五　先合后散　下下 灰冷宝炉寒，樽空兴已阑。 许多欢笑语，浑似梦魂问。
chunks.translated_text:
**Eleventh Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Matters Bring Discontent – Middling**

Fallen leaves fill the courtyard’s ground,
The west wind sweeps the night abode.
The recluse’s heart knows no delight,
How may weariness ever take flight?

Spirit weary, will exhausted, faces the west wind’s mournful sway;
Affairs clumsy, plans awry, sighs at leaves parting their spray.
To cast aside yet cannot—like fowl played with in vain;
To seek yet cannot—like mistaking geese for broth’s gain.

**Twelfth Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Hopes Unfulfilled – Most Inauspicious**

Stars and moon show faintest light,
Dim radiance leaves affairs unclear.
The pavilion’s guest departs in haste,
Heart’s burdens vex the spirit’s grace.

The new moon rises, yet no fullness in cassia’s glow is seen;
The heart’s desire unmet, still tangled in discord’s sheen.
Old friends depart swiftly, sorrow of parting weighs the breast;
Affairs disturb the mind, hardship and hindrance block the quest.

**Thirteenth Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Stagnation Now Eases – Most Auspicious**

Withered trees meet spring anew,
Fragrance fills the dawn’s own hue.
With you I share this joyful sight,
And follow time’s renewing light.

Roots’ wood meets spring’s breeze—leaves flourish, branches thrive;
The virtuous meet fate’s favor—names rise, ranks arrive.
Though freed from long stagnation, virtue’s path is walked anew;
Fortune’s hour now shines—fragrance shared in joyful view.

**Fourteenth Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Ills Fade, Sickness Leaves – Middling**

Long bound by lingering ailment’s chain,
Worries deep as demons’ reign.
Suddenly good medicine appears,
Lightly soaring through clouded spheres.

Endless stagnation like a chronic malady’s embrace;
Layered sorrows like dwelling in a desolate place.
A potent remedy arrives—illness retreats, health restored;
A noble guide lifts one beyond the common horde.

**Fifteenth Oracle of the Hour of Chen – From Misfortune to Blessing – Most Inauspicious**

A lone traveler sets out by night,
Clouds dim, the moon’s pale light.
Only regret fills the desolate air,
Turning back finds no refuge there.

The lone traveler departs as night deepens, the moon descends;
The troubled soul acts—plans flawed, schemes unamend.
To press onward brings unseen peril’s dread;
To retreat offers scant safety instead.

**Sixteenth Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Advancement Ahead – Most Auspicious**

Literary triumph brings return,
Grace bestows robes of honor earned.
Radiance shines with growing might,
Fortune and rank in union bright.

Triumph in the literary field—success as easy as plucking grass;
Advancement in court—favor bright as the sun’s vast pass.
Virtue flourishes, rank and glory rise;
Fortune and blessing make the household thrive.

**Seventeenth Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Inner and Outer Turmoil – Most Inauspicious**

Silent, seated in the empty hall,
A troubled heart remains in thrall.
How bear the paths of men and ghosts,
As household affairs bring ceaseless woes?

Within, discord stirs from family strife;
Without, affairs bring no peace in life.
Grief knots the heart—ghosts and men sigh in despair;
Silent resentment grows—joy scarce, sorrow fills the air.

**Eighteenth Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Peace and Blessing Settle – Most Auspicious**

At dawn, a single incense burns,
Heaven’s will guards and safety turns.
Turn the heart to the great Dao,
Blessings naturally ever grow.

Morning prayers seek the household’s peace;
Sincerity through night brings lengthened ease.
One good deed draws a hundred spirits’ aid, blessings align;
One evil act—ten thousand woes dispelled, faults forgiven, divine.

**Nineteenth Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Heart’s Distance, Affairs Delayed – Middling**

A thousand bushels weigh the ship down,
Waves still clog the ford’s renown.
A thousand-mile ambition stored,
Yet not a single pole’s accord.

The boat grounded on shoals—no oar may stir, no startle’s sound;
Affairs meet obstruction—no progress may be found.
A thousand-mile ambition, yet each step meets delay;
A hundred schemes devised—what use, what way?

**Twentieth Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Sincerity and Fate at Odds – Most Inauspicious**

The child lacks cunning’s art,
Dim wit cannot play its part.
Guard what little will remains,
Till white-haired, home he gains.

The child’s mind lacks wisdom’s spark;
The dull man’s measure falls too dark.
Missed chances—talent fades, name falls, white-haired, no gain;
Great folly—plans awry, shame’s blush brings no relief’s chain.

**Twenty-First Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Hearing Sorrow, Yet Unmoved – Middling**

One leans on the western tower,
Autumn deep, the flute’s notes sour.
Only gaze, need not grieve,
No need for sorrow to weave.

Sorrow stirs at the flute’s mournful sound;
Worries rise at the wild geese’s cry unbound.
Release the sorrow—grief turns to cheer;
Calm the heart—fears dissolve, joy draws near.

**Twenty-Second Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Hearing Joy, Yet Unmoved – Middling**

A lone goose bears empty news,
False tidings, no voice ensues.
Laughing words of joy and woe,
All in vain, mere hearsay’s show.

What is heard—false joy’s report, whence can joy arise?
What is seen—empty flowers, no substance lies.
Vain boasts of praise—no deeds to show;
Empty regrets—resentment’s sting will grow.

**Twenty-Third Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Fortune Comes, Disasters Fade – Most Auspicious**

Virtue aids the good affinity,
Heaven’s decree descends in splendor’s canopy.
Many woes and trials’ weight,
Swept away, no faults remain of late.

Three disasters, eight hardships—self-made woes bring no reprieve;
Four pillars, five phases—knowing fate’s bounds, none may deceive.
Harm dispelled, blessings arrive like sun melting ice;
Faults scattered, fortune blooms like leaves in storm’s device.

**Twenty-Fourth Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Awaiting Time’s Blessing – Middling**

Jade lies hidden in Kunlun’s height,
Its radiance chills the Dipper’s light.
If met by a master’s discerning hand,
Its treasure passed through the land.

Virtue hidden like jade in stone’s embrace;
Fate’s favor like an immortal freed from mortal’s case.
Virtue and benevolence—man’s true treasure, sage or wise;
Gold, jade, pearls—worldly wealth, rich or noble’s prize.

**Twenty-Fifth Oracle of the Hour of Chen – First Union, Then Parting – Most Inauspicious**

Ash cools in the brazier’s cold,
The goblet drained, joy grows old.
Many words of laughter shared,
All now like a dream’s snare.

The brazier’s embers fade to gray;
The cup stands empty, mirth decayed.
So many words of joy once spoken,
All now as if in dreams awoken.

chunks.original_text: 篆消烟灭觉佳既以阑删，筵散樽空知欢娱而寂寞。 鸳侣有离别之恨鸾鉴分收，断弦无再续之期仙音渺绝。 辰时二十六　事多挠搅　下下 扰扰复扰扰，极目清江渺。 孤舟未得回，望信空生恼。 忽忽扰扰目前如理乱丝，或或惶惶心下若焚炎火。 江浩渺而归舟未至目极魂消，意萦恼而所事不通情疑肠断。 辰时二十七　谨防语失　中平 谈笑生荆棘，非言失所言。 若非良友鉴，几被苦牵缠。 触犯忌讳乃刀剑生於口角其口宜缄，讥讼是非而荆棘起於舌端其舌宜卷。 出一语而当三思，举一事而宜详审。 辰时二十八　自谨勿托　中平 举措自端为，行藏更谨机。 托人为所事，恐后变成非。 所为举措远邪佞而亲君子似兰斯馨，动止行藏守端正而去暴慢如松之盛。 敬其事勿托非人，谨其身而戒妄作。 辰时二十九　得时为喜　上上 满目发芳菲，仙园景最奇。 趁逢佳庆节，欢笑醉金。 万卉千葩到阳春而始秀，怀才抱艺得时济而方通。 灵根带春气而发萌，君子遇时机而显达。 辰时三十　快疑退虑　中平 进退正宜新，明人见意深。 好将怀内事，一决自分明。 知进退存亡者乃有先见之明，识利害荣辱者必无后悔之患。 心之疑虑遇良友而晓然，事之幽潜得贵人而明辩。 巳时第一　解怨生恩　中平 念念在存思，相逢正彼如。 向时俨与怨，兹者变欢娱。 以恩解怨炎炎火内生莲，以怨结冤凛凛冰中积雪。 恩不可拖恩深而怨自消，雠不可深俨解而怨自释。 巳时第二　遂意有期　中平 千里关山隔，寸心飞去难。 忽然舟楫便，不可更愁烦。 风快舟便何辞千里之遥，事泰情通自有百祥之助。 遂其意愁烦自释佳贶有期，称其心幽滞自除进谋有望。 巳时第三　待时后遂　中平 一钩新月微，云淡照庭帏。 虽未十分快，团圆终可期。 万物代谢各皆有时，一世荣枯岂得无命。 宝月有圆有缺至三五而皎洁团圆，凡人得遇得时遇际会则亨通显达。 巳时第四　悟道得真　上上 金丹大隐书，玉典降天枢。 秘语今朝赐，凡胎脱下躯。 金丹大典玄真秘密之文，气魄精神形体修护之物。 悟其道者秘语不传之妙羽化飞升，识其理者参详契合之微脱胎换骨。 巳时第五　忧先喜后　中平 荒田久旱时，农业正伤悲。 天泽忽然济，良苗救岁饥。 志学者心图名禄劳苦在先，力耕者意望秋成丰登在后。 天时顺甘膏降泽苗稿重苏，人事和美誉称扬名权复显。 巳时第六　困滞俱生　下下 云昏月又沉，孤客守空庭。 寸心千万意，谁解起愁音。 危难惊惶淹延沉滞，云掩月则光辉不现。 风激水则波浪不宁一事无，谐愁音起寸心不遂嗟叹生。 巳时第七　忽然有喜　上上 高台百尺危，快意望云霓。 天外双双鹤，飞来赐宝机。 脱幽出滞如释重病之躯，快意称心若览春台之日。 鹤飞呜而冲霄羽翼，人脱爽而逸老安居。 巳时第八　不事有成　上上 甘泽降荒田，灵苗发茂鲜。 秋成终有待，佳节保安全。 田畴万顷甘泽降而禾稼荣，口体一身造物顺而名禄显。 举一事有成有遂上德欣然，谋一用处公处正下情允许。 巳时第九　心劳事拙　下下 云外几重云，天书不可闻。 纵然心意恪，殊不听佳音。 密云不雨徒生仰望之心，丹诏不临谩起沉吟之叹，志勤恪返为怠堕功不成，意萦牵殊无听闻事不遂。 已时第十　所愿遂心　上上

**Twenty-Sixth Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Matters Often Entangled – Most Inauspicious**

Incense fades, smoke vanishes—pleasure’s end now plain;
Feast disperses, goblet empty—joy gives way to pain.
Mated birds part with sorrow’s sting,
Mirror’s halves now separate—broken lute’s last ring.
No second chance to mend the string,
The immortal’s melody lost, vanishing.

**Twenty-Sixth Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Matters Often Entangled – Most Inauspicious**

Entangled, ever entangled—endless as the eye can see,
The clear river stretches vast, its waves in ceaseless spree.
A lone boat fails to turn its prow,
Yearning for word, vexation grows now.

Hurried, harried—before one’s eyes, threads in tangled disarray;
Anxious, restless—within the heart, flames of torment burn away.
The river vast, yet no returning boat in sight—gaze strains, the soul decays;
Affairs snarled, hopes unmet—doubt gnaws, the heart in twain.

**Twenty-Seventh Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Guard Against Careless Speech – Middling**

Laughter sows thorns where words mislead,
A slip of tongue brings grief indeed.
Had not a true friend’s wisdom shown,
Nearly ensnared by sorrow’s thorn.

To breach taboos is steel unsheathed at lip’s sharp edge—seal your mouth tight;
To stir dispute is brambles sprouting from the tongue—curl it in silent might.
Speak but once, thrice ponder well;
Act but once, weigh all with care to tell.

**Twenty-Eighth Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Be Cautious, Do Not Entrust – Middling**

Deeds and bearing, upright and true,
Conduct and concealment—judge each move anew.
To trust another with your affair,
Lest later it twist to foul despair.

In all you do, shun the crooked, cleave to the noble—pure as orchid’s scent;
In every step, hold fast to rectitude, cast off arrogance—steadfast as pine’s ascent.
Attend to matters yourself, trust none unwise;
Guard your person, eschew reckless guise.

**Twenty-Ninth Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Timely Joy – Most Auspicious**

Fragrance fills the eye, a blooming sight,
The immortal’s garden, wondrous in its light.
Seizing fortune’s festive tide,
Laughter and mirth in golden cups abide.

A thousand blooms, ten thousand buds—when spring arrives, they rise in splendor;
Talent and skill—when time aligns, their path grows tender.
Roots of spirit, touched by spring’s breath, sprout anew;
The noble, meeting fate’s hour, shines through.

**Thirtieth Oracle of the Hour of Chen – Resolve Doubts, Retreat from Worry – Middling**

Advance and retreat—now is the hour,
The wise perceive the depth of power.
Matters held close within the breast,
Once decided, stand unoppressed.

To know when to advance or yield—this is foresight’s keen art;
To grasp gain and loss, honor and shame—no regret shall mar the heart.
Doubts of the mind, by a true friend made clear;
Hidden affairs, by a noble’s aid brought near.

**First Oracle of the Hour of Si – Resentment Dissolves into Grace – Middling**

Thought upon thought, in reflection’s embrace,
Meeting once more, now in a changed place.
Once steeped in enmity’s chill,
Now transformed to joy’s sweet thrill.

To dissolve resentment with grace is lotus blooming in fire’s core;
To bind enmity with grudge is snow piled on ice’s floor.
Grace must not be withheld—deep grace melts resentment’s frost;
Enmity must not run deep—once eased, grudges are lost.

**Second Oracle of the Hour of Si – Desires Fulfilled in Time – Middling**

A thousand leagues of mountains bar the way,
The heart’s flight falters, lost in disarray.
Yet suddenly, the boat and oars align,
No need for sorrow—fortune now is thine.

Wind swift, boat ready—what are leagues so far?
Affairs flow smooth, a hundred blessings are.
Desires fulfilled, vexation fades away;
Aspirations met, stagnation gives way.

**Third Oracle of the Hour of Si – Awaiting Time’s Fulfillment – Middling**

A crescent moon, its light so slight,
Clouds drift past the courtyard’s night.
Though not yet wholly bright,
Reunion’s time shall come aright.

All things transform in their due season,
A lifetime’s rise and fall—what cause, what reason?
The precious moon waxes and wanes, yet at its height shines full and clear;
Mortals, meeting time and tide, ascend to fortune’s sphere.

**Fourth Oracle of the Hour of Si – Awakening to the Dao, Attaining Truth – Most Auspicious**

The Great Elixir’s hidden script,
Jade texts descend from heaven’s crypt.
Secret words bestowed this day,
Mortal frame now slips away.

The Great Elixir’s canon—mysteries profound,
Qi and spirit, form and essence—guardians bound.
Awakened to the Dao, the unspoken truth takes flight—feathers rise, immortal sound;
Grasping its principle, the subtle threads align—bone and flesh transform, reborn anew.

**Fifth Oracle of the Hour of Si – First Sorrow, Then Joy – Middling**

A barren field, long parched with drought,
The farmer’s heart with sorrow fraught.
Then heaven’s mercy sends its rain,
Good shoots revive, famine’s bane.

The scholar’s heart, fixed on fame and gain, toils through hardship’s night;
The tiller’s hope, set on autumn’s yield, awaits harvest’s light.
When timely rains descend, the withered stalks revive;
When human affairs align, renown and rank revive.

**Sixth Oracle of the Hour of Si – All Entangled in Stagnation – Most Inauspicious**

Clouds obscure, the moon sinks low,
A lonely traveler in an empty court below.
A thousand thoughts within the heart’s small space,
Who understands the sorrow’s trace?

Peril and dread, prolonged in stagnant air,
Clouds veil the moon—its light is not there.
Wind stirs the waves—no peace upon the tide;
One matter unsolved—vexation’s sighs abide.

**Seventh Oracle of the Hour of Si – Sudden Joy – Most Auspicious**

A lofty terrace, perilous and high,
Joyful the gaze to cloud and sky.
From beyond the heavens, a pair of cranes appear,
Flying near to grant a treasure dear.

Freed from gloom, as if from illness’ weight;
Heart’s delight, as spring’s first sunlit gate.
Cranes cry out, soaring on wings unbound;
Man, unshackled, finds peace profound.

**Eighth Oracle of the Hour of Si – Success Without Striving – Most Auspicious**

Sweet rains fall on barren ground,
Sacred shoots in splendor crowned.
Autumn’s harvest waits its time,
Safe through seasons, fortune’s climb.

Fields of ten thousand acres—sweet rains make the grain thrive;
One body, one life—when creation favors, rank and name arrive.
One deed accomplished, one aim achieved—high virtue rejoices;
One plan well-laid, one path upright—all hearts approve its choices.

**Ninth Oracle of the Hour of Si – Toil of Mind, Clumsiness in Affairs – Most Inauspicious**

Cloud beyond cloud, veiling the sky,
Heaven’s decree remains unheard on high.
Though the heart be earnest, true,
No glad tidings reach you.

Dense clouds, yet no rain—vain the upward gaze;
Unissued edicts—sighs in vain ablaze.
Zeal and diligence turn to sloth, work undone;
Hopes entwined, yet no word comes—affairs go wrong, undone.

**Tenth Oracle of the Hour of Si – Wishes Aligned with the Heart – Most Auspicious**

**Twenty-Fifth Oracle of the Hour of Chen – First Union, Then Parting – Most Inauspicious**

Ash cools in the brazier’s cold,

Many words of laughter shared,
All now like a dream’s snare.

chunks.original_text: 坐久待婵娟，云开宝月圆。 开樽共清赏，万虑一齐捐。 云开天净宝月现而宇宙澄清，灾退病除吉福临而谋用称遂。 开樽俎而赏心乐事，涤念虑而事泰心安。 巳时第十一　有助无阻　上上 长江千里远，风静水纹平。 好称扁舟去，谋为尽契情。 得道者自然多助左逢挈而右逢提，得时者何患无功上遇合而下遇顺。 风静者水平舟稳，契意者事遂情欢。 巳时十二　情乖事背　下下 冰炭不同炉，彼情非我情。 更宜自详谨，心事勿相论。 水火不可同处为其性质两殊，贤愚不可并居为其智识不俾。 殊异共处情必乖，邪正并居谋必背。 巳时十三　贵人接引　上上 天福载文书，欣欣各遂如。 朱衣相接引，权要两相扶。 文书有气天禄驾而云奔，谋用无疑朱衣引而风助。 当权握者欣欣接遇进爵添阶，临要路者稳稳扶持升名益禄。 巳时十四　小害无伤　中平 一鬼暗中笑，岂知相窃窥，虽无十分害，第恐有微非。 人有鬼人，物有鬼物。 生妬害者谓之鬼人，作祟怪者谓之鬼物。 除鬼物者有天心之正法易以躯，除辟鬼人无治术之良方难为禁止。 巳时十五　顺守无害　中平 财利欲成时，人情两是非。 顺之自和悦，终保少忧危。 父子兄弟之不睦多以因财，同侪朋友之不和岂非争竞。 利之者愈为不足失义亏仁，让之者顺而自安名光誉美。 已时十六　渐有涯际　中平 景色始光辉，忧心自退之，方能进寸步，渐可近天墀。 昏暝已退景色渐渐清明，忧虑已消佳既徐徐安泰。 进寸步可通千里何患不周，谋一事可保百祥何忧不遂。 巳时十七　敬真助福　上上 丹炉宝篆焚，亲事祝吾尊。 助尔清缘福，心专道自存。 奉真者得其真力遇难自消，奉佛者得其佛慈逢灾自释。 焚宝炉之丹篆默祷虔诚，赐遐福之恩光昭明静应。 巳时十八　阴小不宁　下下 鬼昧苦相持，家庭阴小危。 举心行善事，解释自安机。 家庭危厄盖因岁赛年灾，鬼魅侵欺多是志乖意僻。 正其心而行其事阴小自宁，安其志而戒其非灾害自息。 已时十九　未遂如心　下下 旱地岂行舟，归心未得由。 空令烟障客，兀兀意悠悠。 倚舟旱地岂能济而能行，用事搏空岂得成而得遂。 归心未展空悠悠而惆怅多，诚意未周馒兀兀而欢悦少。 巳时二十　起滞发幽　上上 宝剑射穹苍，邪幽鬼魅藏，更无他滞碍，威德发名扬。 宝剑乃正真君子射斗冲牛，鬼魅乃阴邪小人伏幽藏隐。 威令发宣扬道德以正除邪，功力就起拔幽潜以恩成福。 巳时二十一　灾退福生　上上 天乐发清音，仙车降宅庭。 门阑光赫赫，阖庆受嘉恩。 灵音清亮用事和而嘉信，临仙车降庭动则吉而美。 事集浮灾微恼天边已逐云，飞禄庆恩华户内福随春至。 巳时二十二　旧事再成　上上 旧事复重新，退心变进心。 分明幽滞客，翻作步云人。 退心复进始知时有变更，事再重新方表命逢协助。 不失青毡之故物幽闲重问，得赡金鉴之辉光容颜复整。 巳时二十三　有助成喜　上上 归心得便舟，扰意复优游。 不必更惆怅，故人相遇周。 归心切切幸逢顺便之舟，扰意惶惶忽变优游之乐。 幽滞脱而亨途快爽春满江山，贵人进而成遂周圆光生闾里。 巳时二十四　宜守勿动　中平 且守不可动，动之事必讹。 月寒庭下静，风鼓水中波。 人若谋动吉凶悔吝生焉、心若妄求福

**Eleventh Oracle of the Hour of Si – Aid Without Obstruction – Most Auspicious**

Long seated, awaiting the fair moon,
Clouds part—treasure orb rounds full and bright.
Raise the cup, share in pure delight,
Ten thousand cares cast aside as one.

Clouds disperse, skies clear—treasure moon reveals a cosmos serene;
Disasters retreat, illness fades—auspicious fortune descends, plans align.
Uncork the wine, feast the heart in joyous accord,
Purge all thoughts—affairs prosper, the mind rests in peace.

**Twelfth Oracle of the Hour of Si – Discordant Hearts, Reversed Affairs – Most Inauspicious**

Ice and coal share no hearth,
Their natures clash, their hearts apart.
Best to reflect with care,
Lest your heart’s affairs be laid bare.

Water and fire cannot dwell as one—for their natures stand opposed,
Wise and foolish cannot share a home—for their wisdom is not aligned.
Differing natures breed discord in hearts,
Righteous and crooked schemes cannot coincide.

**Thirteenth Oracle of the Hour of Si – Noble Ones Offer Guidance – Most Auspicious**

Heaven’s blessing bears the writ,
Joy abounds—all wishes fit.
Crimson-robed ones draw near,
Power and favor lend support clear.

The writ bears qi—heaven’s bounty rides the rushing clouds,
Plans meet no doubt—crimson robes guide with wind’s aid.
Those who hold sway greet you with gladness, ranks and titles ascend,
Those at the crossroads steady your rise, fame and fortune extend.

**Fourteenth Oracle of the Hour of Si – Minor Harm, No Injury – Neutral**

A ghost laughs in the dark,
Unseen, it watches, lurks apart.
Though no grave harm befalls,
Still, small misfortunes may impart.

Men have their ghostly foes,
Things their spectral woes.
Those who breed envy and spite are called ghost-men,
Those who stir strife and omens are called ghost-things.
To banish ghost-things, heaven’s just law is easily wielded,
To ward off ghost-men, no fine art exists—restraint is seldom heeded.

**Fifteenth Oracle of the Hour of Si – Yield and Remain Unharmed – Neutral**

When wealth and gain near fruition,
Human hearts breed contention.
Yield, and harmony shall reign,
Preserving peace, sparing pain.

Father and son, brother and brother—discord often springs from gain,
Comrades and friends—strife arises from rivalry and claim.
Those who grasp for more grow ever unsatisfied, virtue and kindness fade,
Those who yield find ease, their names shine bright, their reputations made.

**Sixteenth Oracle of the Hour of Si – Gradual Reach of Limits – Neutral**

Light begins to gleam,
Worries fade like a dream.
Each step forward, though small,
Brings you closer to the hall.

Dusk retreats, the scene grows bright,
Anxieties dissolve—calm takes flight.
A single step may span a thousand li—what need for fear?
One plan secured ensures a hundred blessings—what cause for doubt is here?

**Seventeenth Oracle of the Hour of Si – Reverence Invokes Blessing – Most Auspicious**

Cinnabar furnace, sacred script aflame,
Prayers ascend to the honored name.
Fortune’s pure thread aids your quest,
Heart devoted—the Dao remains possessed.

Those who serve the true gain its power, trials dissolve unseen,
Those who honor the Buddha gain his mercy, disasters fade serene.
Burning sacred script in the cinnabar furnace, prayers rise in silent devotion,
Bestowing distant blessings—grace shines bright in tranquil response.

**Eighteenth Oracle of the Hour of Si – Yin’s Petty Disturbance – Most Inauspicious**

Ghosts obscure, clinging tight,
Household yin stirs minor blight.
Turn your heart to good deeds done,
Peace restored—troubles undone.

Household peril stems from ill-fated years and misfortune’s weight,
Ghostly intrusions thrive where wills stray and hearts deviate.
Right your heart, act with rectitude—yin’s pettiness will cease,
Steady your resolve, forsake all wrong—disasters fade, bring peace.

**Nineteenth Oracle of the Hour of Si – Wishes Yet Unfulfilled – Most Inauspicious**

A boat on dry land—how to sail?
The heart’s return finds no avail.
Vainly the traveler lingers, veiled in mist,
Restless, adrift—his spirit dismissed.

A boat on parched earth cannot cross nor glide,
Schemes built on emptiness cannot thrive nor abide.
The heart’s return unmet—vain longing, sorrow’s tide,
Sincerity incomplete—joy scarce, hope denied.

**Twentieth Oracle of the Hour of Si – Dispelling Stagnation, Revealing the Hidden – Most Auspicious**

Treasure sword pierces the vaulted sky,
Malevolent shades and lurking sprites fly.
No obstruction remains,
Virtue’s might spreads its name.

The treasure sword is the true and noble one—shooting the Dipper, charging the Ox,
Ghosts and specters are the yin and the crooked—hiding in shadows, lost.
Decrees issued, virtue’s might dispels the perverse,
Efforts made, the hidden rise—grace and fortune reverse.

**Twenty-First Oracle of the Hour of Si – Disasters Retreat, Fortune Arises – Most Auspicious**

Heaven’s music sounds in pure refrain,
Immortal chariots descend to the domain.
Gates and halls blaze with radiant light,
All within receive blessings bright.

Celestial strains resound—affairs harmonize, trust and joy align,
Immortal chariots alight—each move brings fortune, each sign benign.
Floating misfortunes, fleeting woes—driven beyond the clouds’ embrace,
Flying emoluments, blessings bright—spring’s bounty fills the household space.

**Twenty-Second Oracle of the Hour of Si – Old Matters Renewed – Most Auspicious**

Old affairs revive anew,
Retreat turns to bold pursue.
Once a guest in shadows deep,
Now a cloud-borne traveler’s leap.

Retreat shifts to advance—know the hour’s change,
Affairs reborn—fate’s aid is in range.
Not losing the old felt’s hue, seclusion’s call,
Gaining the golden mirror’s glow—countenance restored, standing tall.

**Twenty-Third Oracle of the Hour of Si – Aid Brings Joyful Success – Most Auspicious**

The heart’s return finds a vessel true,
Troubled thoughts dissolve in ease anew.
No need for lingering despair,
Old friends gather, all is fair.

The heart’s longing meets a vessel’s timely tide,
Anxious thoughts transform to leisure’s glide.
Stagnation shed, the open road—spring’s joy fills hill and stream,
Noble aid advances—success shines, the village gleams.

**Twenty-Fourth Oracle of the Hour of Si – Best to Remain Still – Neutral**

Hold fast, do not stir,
Movement brings error’s blur.
Moon cold, the courtyard still,
Wind stirs the water’s thrill.

If one schemes and acts, fortune and misfortune, regret and shame arise,
If the heart seeks recklessly, blessings fade before one’s eyes.

chunks.original_text: 祸灾祥立至。 惟静守月照庭而清幽，惟动求风鼓波而汹涌。 巳时二十五　是非扰括　下下 月落又空山，清幽事已阑。 寸心千里远，俱在是非间。 人之迍赛作事是而反成非，时之乖违道本亨而复为否。 谋疏计拙寸心千里之间，信远音沉月落空山之外。 巳时二十六　有气可成　中平 寒灰事复然，休言事向迁。 若逢人力助，咫尺是前缘。 星落寒灰忽有复然之喜，凋零枯木再生返绿之荣。 候其时而进咫尺可期，得其助而成因而可就。 巳时二十七　庆会亨通　上上 得意发新文，纵横道济民。 风云相庆会，惟尔保安宁。 事获称遂曰得意，心无挂碍曰纵横，云龙风虎盘旋於金鼎之中，达圣通真庆会於蓬壶之上。 巳时二十八　和合通达　上上 豺狼陷石崖，行客免忧怀。 去路平如掌，相随意自谐。 豺狼当道幸然天已驱除，谋用始通顿尔心无忧恼。 去路平前程坦率进达四方，事遂成众志谐和利名相美。 巳时二十九　脱灾用事　上上 阴小脱重危，家庭渐有辉。 许多忧恼事，风扫变尘微。 阴小重重之危厄日照薄冰，自身坎坎之灾愆风飘枯叶。 败毁褛台复鼎新而修茸，歌倾树木再培植以扶持。 已时三十　福庆两生　上上 鸾凤舞翱翔，香风降吉祥。 大开佳庆宴，共集福华阳。 安静无祸曰福，道德兴隆曰庆。 鸾凤翱翔为天下瑞，善念滋长则禄寿昌。 积善者余庆乃生，积德者遐福必至。 午时第一　迟疑未达　下下 有意玩仙乡，三山路渺茫。 不能升一步，惟恨对斜阳。 蓬莱三岛之乡有所闻而无所见，求谋远望之事已所用而未所成。 志甚速而行甚迟，得甚难而失甚易。 午时第二　喜用有助　上上 行遍几重山，今方得遂安。 更逢人指引，得鹿始回还。 涉水登山历遍崎岖之险，退灾进福方成称遂之安。 得人指引有功其功允济，得鹿回还有喜其喜普欢。 午时第三　喜中有忧　下下 叆叇起云霓，晴天忽变悲。 一天星斗暗，不见月光辉。 平宁安静恐生蹶步之忧，喜笑欢欣虑有欢眉之叹。 云霓忽起一天幽暗而生，星月潜光满目晦冥而至。 午时第四　赐福得庆　上上 枯槁本无气，阳和一变春。 东君施化力，均济普沾恩。 枯槁之木非东君不能发萌，职禄之来非贵人不能陶铸。 田畴丰熟因沾雨露之恩，草木敷荣均赖阳和之力。 午时第五　超凡入圣　上上 青云去路遥，仙籍姓名标。 自有长生诀，丹砂出圣苗。 道高德就名标仙籍之中，行满功成位列天曹之内。 得长生之妙诀返老还童，授丹鼎之玄微降龙伏虎。 午时第六　忧喜未庾　中平 混沌似冥昏，忧欢尚未分。 秪须天地豁，鸡犬始能闻。 混沌冥昏之际尚未能分，忧喜进退之间尚未能次。 更待天清地朗虑之事尽消，始闻犬吠鸡呜是非之端方觉。 午时第七　守静待吉　中平 大道欲清幽，存心勿妄求。 任他空挠聒，一意止存修。 守道之人心欲安而神欲静，浮华之士意多妄而念多浮。 天与寿惟存修而待之，否与通但操正而执耳。 午时第八　散忧退事　中平 退事勿再举，进心且息然。 妄传多少意，是非不能前。 忧事如水上轻沤不能持久，喜事若空中搏影岂可得成。 所谋所用徒劳役志役心，散喜散忧方可免灾免咎。 午时第九　虚空不实　下下 一溪春水流，花落满芳洲。 空作春花梦，悠悠事未周。 榆钱不可以济乏，画饼不可以充饥。

**Twenty-Fifth Oracle of the Hour of Si – Strife and Entanglement – Most Inauspicious**

Disaster and fortune stand poised to arrive,
Stillness holds—moonlight bathes the courtyard in serene light,
Movement seeks—wind churns waves into surging might.

The moon sets, the mountains stand empty,
All tranquil affairs now fade away.
A heart’s inch spans a thousand miles,
All entangled in strife’s sway.

When one’s affairs are right yet turn to wrong,
When time’s favor shifts from smooth to blocked,
Plans grow sparse, schemes grow dull—
A heart’s inch spans a thousand miles,
Trust fades, echoes sink beyond the moon’s fall in hollow hills.

---

**Twenty-Sixth Oracle of the Hour of Si – Qi Brings Completion – Neutral**

Cold ashes stir anew,
No need to speak of change’s flow.
If human aid appears,
Near and far, fate’s thread will show.

Fallen stars, cold ashes—suddenly life rekindles bright,
Withered wood, barren branches—green returns in verdant light.
Wait for the hour, advance—success lies close at hand,
With aid received, the cause takes form, the work is firmly planned.

---

**Twenty-Seventh Oracle of the Hour of Si – Celebration and Flourishing – Most Auspicious**

Joy finds voice in fresh verse,
Unfettered, the Dao aids the people’s course.
Wind and cloud in glad reunion,
Only thus is peace secure.

Success brings delight—this is "joy’s voice,"
Unobstructed heart—this is "unfettered course."
Cloud-dragon, wind-tiger coil within the golden crucible,
Transcendent communion graces the immortal isle’s hall.

---

**Twenty-Eighth Oracle of the Hour of Si – Harmony and Free Flow – Most Auspicious**

Jackals and wolves trapped in rocky ravines,
Travelers’ worries now fade away.
The road ahead lies smooth as a palm,
Companions follow, hearts in accord.

Jackals and wolves once blocked the path—now heaven has swept them aside,
Plans at last flow free, all cares dissolve in an instant’s tide.
The road ahead stretches level, the journey unfolds with ease,
Success achieved, collective will harmonizes—glory and profit increase.

---

**Twenty-Ninth Oracle of the Hour of Si – Escaping Disaster – Most Auspicious**

Yin’s shadows shed their heavy peril,
The household slowly regains its glow.
Countless trials and sorrows,
Swept away like dust in the wind’s flow.

Yin’s layered perils melt like ice beneath the sun,
Personal misfortunes scatter like leaves before the wind’s run.
Ruined halls rise anew, restored with care,
Felled trees stand tall again, nurtured with repair.

---

**Thirtieth Oracle of the Hour of Si – Dual Blessings of Fortune – Most Auspicious**

Phoenixes dance in soaring flight,
Fragrant winds descend with auspicious light.
A grand feast of joy unfolds,
All gather in fortune’s radiant height.

Peace without calamity—this is "fortune,"
Virtue’s flourishing rise—this is "blessing."
Phoenixes soaring herald heaven’s grace,
Good thoughts growing bring rank and longevity’s embrace.
Those who accumulate goodness beget lasting reward,
Those who cultivate virtue secure distant blessing’s accord.

---

**First Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Hesitation Blocks Progress – Most Inauspicious**

Intent on wandering the immortal realm,
The three mountains’ path remains distant, dim.
Unable to ascend a single step,
Only regret lingers before the slanting sun.

The isles of Penglai—heard of but never seen,
Distant schemes—envisioned but never achieved.
Aspirations swift, yet progress slow,
Gains elusive, losses come with ease.

---

**Second Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Joyful Aid Brings Success – Most Auspicious**

Traversed countless mountains’ height,
Now at last finds rest and peace.
Meeting one who points the way,
The deer is found, the return brings release.

Crossing rivers, climbing peaks—enduring every peril’s test,
Retreating from disaster, advancing fortune—at last finds rest.
With guidance received, the merit is complete,
The deer secured, the return brings joy replete.

---

**Third Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Joy Veiled by Sorrow – Most Inauspicious**

Dark clouds gather thick,
Clear skies suddenly turn bleak.
The heavens’ stars grow dim,
No moonlight’s glow to seek.

Peace and calm may yet bring stumbling woe,
Laughter and joy may hide a furrowed brow’s shadow.
Dark clouds rise—day turns to gloom,
Stars and moon hide their light—all is shrouded in doom.

---

**Fourth Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Heaven’s Blessing Bestowed – Most Auspicious**

Withered and lifeless, devoid of qi,
Yang’s warmth transforms all to spring.
The Eastern Lord exerts his power,
Bestowing grace in equal measure.

Withered trees cannot sprout without the Eastern Lord’s might,
Rank and emolument cannot form without a noble’s light.
Fields and crops thrive by rain and dew’s embrace,
Grass and trees flourish by yang’s warming grace.

---

**Fifth Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Transcending the Mundane – Most Auspicious**

The path to blue clouds stretches far,
Immortal rolls bear one’s name inscribed.
The elixir of long life is found,
Divine sprouts emerge from cinnabar refined.

Dao perfected, virtue complete—names etched in immortal scrolls,
Merit fulfilled, deeds done—seated among celestial roles.
Attaining the wondrous secret of long life, youth is restored,
Receiving the profound mystery of the alchemical hearth, dragons are tamed, tigers ignored.

---

**Sixth Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Joy and Sorrow Unresolved – Neutral**

Chaos like primordial darkness,
Joy and sorrow yet unclear.
Only when heaven and earth part,
Will cock’s crow and dog’s bark appear.

In chaos’ murky haze, distinctions blur,
Between joy and sorrow, advance and retreat—order unsure.
Wait until heaven clears and earth brightens—then all cares dissolve,
Only then will cock’s crow and dog’s bark reveal right and wrong’s resolve.

---

**Seventh Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Stillness Awaits Auspicious Signs – Neutral**

The great Dao seeks clarity and stillness,
Hold fast, do not seek in vain.
Let others clamor in empty noise,
Focus the mind on cultivation’s plane.

Those who guard the Dao seek a heart at peace, a spirit serene,
Those drawn to fleeting splendor chase reckless thoughts, their minds untamed.
Heaven grants longevity—await it through steadfast cultivation,
Fortune and misfortune—hold to integrity’s foundation.

---

**Eighth Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Dispel Worries, Retreat from Affairs – Neutral**

Retreat from affairs, do not pursue,
Still the heart, let it rest.
Vain rumors spread countless schemes,
Strife cannot advance the quest.

Worries are like bubbles on water—fleeting, unsustainable,
Joy is like shadows in air—elusive, unattainable.
All schemes and efforts weary mind and will in vain,
Dispel joy, dispel sorrow—only then avoid calamity’s stain.

---

**Ninth Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Emptiness and Unreality – Most Inauspicious**

A spring stream flows,
Petals fall upon the fragrant isle.
An empty dream of spring’s bloom,
All affairs remain incomplete.

Elm coins cannot relieve want,
Painted cakes cannot sate hunger’s cry.

Stagnation shed, the open road—spring’s joy fills hill and stream,
Noble aid advances—success shines, the village gleams.

**Twenty-Fourth Oracle of the Hour of Si – Best to Remain Still – Neutral**

Hold fast, do not stir,
Movement brings error’s blur.
Moon cold, the courtyard still,
Wind stirs the water’s thrill.

If one schemes and acts, fortune and misfortune, regret and shame arise,
If the heart seeks recklessly, blessings fade before one’s eyes.

chunks.original_text: 传不可以信虚，名不可以听实。 落花过目随即扫空，春梦惊徊无可玩味。 午时第十　待时有望　中下 宝鼎尚沉埋，才高未克谐。 一朝龙虎会，有职尽添阶。 事之未济如金玉沉於泥沙，时之未逢纵才智岂能亨达。 龙虎盘旋交会变异风云，时运际合亨通骤迁禄职。 午时十一　疾退病除　上上 抱疾未能痊，良医在目前。 不须多怅恨，非久得安全。 膏肓之病遇良医则起死回生，迷惑之心逢成病则顿开解悟。 灾厄若退其病忽尔而痊，命运若通其福自然而至。 午时十二　终有成望　上上 有鹿在山前，新花满目妍。 历终微险阻，大可展愁颜。 遂鹿者历遍崎岖之险，玩花者曾经霜雪之寒。 虽先见於至艰至难终成称遂，乃始逢於从心从欲大展欢颜。 午时十三　扶持有获　中平 护助非人力，扶持乃至真。 分明舟欲 覆，乃得渡平津。 大厦将欹非大力而不能正，沉舟欲覆非神助而不可扶。 平津得渡分明险处逢安，彼岸得临幸尔危中有救。 午时十四　文书利泰　上上 千里一丹书，传来自宝枢。 望中为得意，职禄两相扶。 丹诏来从千里恩宠光华，宝枢赐於一朝官班品贵。 叩文书文书有气化笔陶镕，占职禄职禄有荣贵人助顺。 午时十五　先阻后泰　上上 历尽几重山，云开天地宽。 不须多着力，平步到玄关。 涉水登山历尽艰辛之阻障，云开天诤幸逢爽快之良时。 玄开到而不远劳役休辞，谋用进而有期不须着力。 午时十六　合成非久　下下 衰朽又何为，空言白首归。 夕阳虽有景，第恐不多时。 衰朽之木非梁楝之奇才，轻诺之言非信实之良语。 彩云虹影终不耐於久观，风梗浪萍必暂聚而复散。 午时十七　守静勿用　中平 秋色到人间，庭空月正闲，丹炉香寂寂，百事不相干。 性静情逸惠光朗朗圆明，心动神疲业大炎炎炽赫，心火定丹炉寂寂万祸不侵，障云散夜月闲闲一毫不扰。 午时十八　括扰未宁　下下 是是与非非，稠人扰自为。 欲求清净理，尤自格关机。 咎吝生於自扰扰则不宁，是非起自喧争争则有怨。 关机藏隐逢怨恶而自灭自消，清净无为遇冤尤而自解自释。 午时十九　忧事无害　中平 病虎卧前溪，前人望自为。 不能生陷害，何用设狐疑。 恶心如猛虎当道不可不避，举步如履冰而行不可不谨。 曰敬曰恭灾害自然不生，守正守真咎吝何由而作。 午时二十　得道成合　上上 洞庭春色阑，仙友会云班。 好觅长生药，逍遥饵大还。 仙岩碧洞满天月白风清，紫府蓬壶匝地普天春色。 道果成长生久视饱食蟠桃，功力就快乐逍遥飞升仙境。 午时二十一　门户不宁　下下 幽鬼晴来退，家门气象阴。 谨身三七内，渐可退馄迍。 亏心暗毒谓之幽幽隐不明，害人窃物谓之鬼鬼邪侵扰。 门庭挠括宜镇静而消禳，群小争喧当谨身而退避。 午时二十二　得恩感惠　上上 得道始提携，超凡入圣机。 感心常激切，恩惠足扶持。 得人提拔者谓之恩其恩最大，与人财禄者谓之惠其惠尤探。 中心藏之常怀感激之心，何日忘之自有神真之助。 午时二十三　忧中有喜　上上 雷轰掣雷时，邪魅已潜机。 幸得风云散，天高月正辉。 轰雷掣电岂诛有德之人，白璧黄金不赐无功之子。 邪魅消幽魔荡息道气冲和，风云散星月光辉乾坤澄静。 午时二十四　谗妬相害　下下

**Tenth Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Awaiting the Hour with Hope – Neutral-Low**

Rumors cannot be trusted as truth,
Names cannot be heard as fact.
Falling blossoms pass before the eye—soon swept away,
A spring dream lingers in startled hesitation—nothing to savor.

The treasure tripod still lies buried,
Talent high yet unfulfilled.
One day when dragon and tiger meet,
Office and rank shall both ascend.

Unresolved affairs are like gold and jade sunk in mud,
Unmet times render talent and wit futile.
Dragon and tiger coil in mutual dance, shifting wind and cloud,
When fortune’s hour aligns, prosperity and rank swiftly rise.

---

**Eleventh Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Illness Retreats, Disease Vanishes – Most Auspicious**

Gripped by illness, not yet healed,
A skilled physician stands before you.
No need for long lament—
Soon, safety shall be restored.

Illness in the vital organs, met by a good doctor, revives the dying,
A deluded heart, touched by true healing, awakens in sudden clarity.
If misfortune retreats, sickness vanishes in an instant,
If fate turns favorable, fortune arrives as naturally as breath.

---

**Twelfth Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Success in Sight – Most Auspicious**

A deer stands before the mountain,
Fresh blossoms dazzle the eye.
Though minor perils have been endured,
Great joy may now unfold the furrowed brow.

The deer-hunter traverses rugged and treacherous paths,
The flower-lover endures frost and snow.
Though first faced with utmost hardship and trial,
At last, desires are fulfilled, and smiles bloom wide.

---

**Thirteenth Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Support Yields Reward – Neutral**

Protection is no mortal force,
Support comes from the truest source.
A boat nearly capsized—
Yet safely crosses the calm ford.

A towering hall, tilting, cannot be righted without great strength,
A sinking ship cannot be steadied without divine aid.
The calm ford is crossed—clearly, peril met with peace,
The far shore is reached—providentially, danger finds rescue.

---

**Fourteenth Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Documents Bring Prosperity – Most Auspicious**

A thousand leagues away, a crimson decree arrives,
Delivered from the treasure vault.
In hope, it brings delight—
Office and emolument both upheld.

A vermilion edict comes from afar, its grace radiant,
The treasure vault bestows rank in a single day, noble and esteemed.
Knock upon the document—its words are shaped by qi’s alchemy,
Divine office and emolument—fortune’s favor aids their course.

---

**Fifteenth Oracle of the Hour of Wu – First Obstruction, Then Prosperity – Most Auspicious**

Having crossed countless mountains,
Clouds part, and heaven and earth expand.
No need for great exertion—
Step lightly to the mysterious gate.

Wading through waters, scaling peaks, enduring hardship’s barriers,
Clouds disperse, the sky clears—fortune’s bright hour arrives.
The mysterious gate is near—no need to shun toil,
Plans advance, the time is ripe—no need for straining force.

---

**Sixteenth Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Union Soon Undone – Most Inauspicious**

What use is decay’s labor?
Empty words speak of white-haired return.
Though the setting sun holds beauty,
Its glow cannot last long.

A rotting tree is no pillar of rare timber,
A careless promise is no word of true faith.
Rainbow hues and rosy clouds cannot long endure,
Wind-tossed driftwood and floating duckweed must scatter again.

---

**Seventeenth Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Maintain Stillness, Do Not Act – Neutral**

Autumn’s hues descend upon the world,
The courtyard is empty, the moon at ease.
The cinnabar furnace stands silent,
A hundred affairs touch not the heart.

Stillness of nature, ease of spirit—wisdom’s light shines clear and bright,
Restlessness of heart, weariness of spirit—karma’s fire blazes fierce.
When the heart’s fire settles, the furnace grows quiet—no disaster invades,
When obstructing clouds disperse, the night moon shines undisturbed—no trace intrudes.

---

**Eighteenth Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Turmoil Yet Unsettled – Most Inauspicious**

Right and wrong, right and wrong,
The crowd stirs, each acting for themselves.
Seeking the principle of clarity and stillness,
Yet the mechanism remains locked.

Faults and regrets arise from self-inflicted turmoil—turmoil brings no peace,
Right and wrong emerge from clamorous strife—strife breeds resentment.
The mechanism lies hidden—meeting malice, it self-destructs,
Practicing non-action—facing grievance, it self-dissolves.

---

**Nineteenth Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Worries Bring No Harm – Neutral**

A sick tiger lies by the stream,
The passerby watches, wary.
Yet it cannot cause harm—
Why harbor needless doubt?

A malevolent heart is like a tiger blocking the path—one must not fail to avoid it,
Each step is like treading upon ice—one must not fail to tread carefully.
With reverence and deference, disaster naturally does not arise,
Holding to integrity and truth, how can faults and regrets take form?

---

**Twentieth Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Attaining the Dao, Union Achieved – Most Auspicious**

Dongting’s spring colors fade,
Immortal friends gather in cloud-borne ranks.
Seek well the elixir of long life,
Roam freely, partaking of the Great Return.

Jade caves and azure grottoes fill with moonlight and clear wind,
Purple palaces and Penglai Isles blanket the earth in spring’s splendor.
The Dao’s fruit ripens—long life and enduring vision, feasting on immortal peaches,
Merit is complete—joyfully roaming, ascending to the realm of immortals.

---

**Twenty-First Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Household in Turmoil – Most Inauspicious**

Hidden ghosts retreat in daylight,
The household’s aura darkens.
Guard yourself within twenty-one days—
Gradually, misfortune may recede.

A guilty conscience, dark poison—veiled and unseen,
Harming others, stealing goods—ghostly, perverse intrusion.
The household’s discord demands stillness and exorcism,
When petty minds clamor, withdraw and avoid.

---

**Twenty-Second Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Receiving Grace and Favor – Most Auspicious**

Attaining the Dao begins with guidance,
Transcending the ordinary, entering the sage’s mechanism.
A moved heart ever fervent,
Grace and favor suffice to uphold.

Receiving another’s lift—this is grace, the greatest grace,
Bestowing wealth and rank—this is favor, the deepest favor.
Cherish it within—ever hold a grateful heart,
Never forget it—divine aid shall surely come.

---

**Twenty-Third Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Joy Amidst Sorrow – Most Auspicious**

Thunder crashes, lightning flashes,
Malevolent spirits have fled in hiding.
Fortunately, wind and cloud disperse—
The sky is high, the moon shines bright.

Thunder and lightning do not strike the virtuous,
White jade and yellow gold are not bestowed upon the undeserving.
Malevolent spirits vanish, dark demons dissolve—Dao’s qi harmonizes,
Wind and cloud scatter, stars and moon gleam—heaven and earth grow serene.

---

chunks.original_text: 佞语巧非常，侵之必有伤。 暗中藏利刃，切欲要堤防。 佞人悦己面必誉而背必非，谗口阴谋快似刀而利似剑。 比之蜂姜之毒其毒尤探，比之虎狼之恶其恶尤甚。 午时二十五　道合遂成　上上 宝骑疾如飞，青云得路时。 机谋相遇合，成遂岂能迟。 前程通达乘宝骑以如飞，高步逍遥上青云而得路。 谋成遇合言必听而计必从，福至心灵物必亨而名必遂。 午时二十六　防谨言谤　下下 烈火烧珠玉，谗言毁善良。 若人非解忿，几致有危伤。 珠玉之美必有纤瑕之析，善良之士岂无谗毁之非。 消谗灭毁当宜洁己修身，解忿释愆尤在退思改过。 午时二十七　用心不遂　下下 独立斜阳裹，残蝉吸晚风。 一庭秋寂寞，更漏已成空。 残蝉斜日知景物以凄凉，落叶西风觉秋容而寂寞。 更漏永梦中作梦梦寐不安，心诸乱忧内怀忧忧疑未决。 午时二十八　琢磨成器　上上 一跃龙门裹，桃花浪丧重。 如今身得意，劳逸已成功。 文场得意始酬立志之勤劳，蟾宫攀桂已遂鸡窗之学业。 发奋志龙门一跃，冠群伦名播四方。 午时二十九　得遇扶持　上上 念念一何求，忧心未得周。 忽然人借力，携接上云游。 惟日孜孜一成名而成德亨。 途坦坦万斯箱而千斯仓。 遇上人之协助风力吹毛，逢大贵而提拥云开见日。 午时三十　名利不遂　下下 财散风彼裹，名标云雾间。 利名皆不遂，回首掩柴关。 财宝散失沉埋万顷风波，名位虚无障隔一天云雾。 回首者利不获而名不就，掩关者闭不开而塞不通。 未时第一　家门利泰　上上 五福寿为先，年高禄更延。 一门佳气集，长幼庆安然。 康宁富寿五福备而天下尊，嘉庆安和一门集而长幼顺。 孝於亲者天．道助而家道昌，敬於真者吉事修而恶事退。 未时第二　名禄成遂　上上 鹿驾文书急，花开燕作喧。 春花成遂合，每事喜相连。 鹿驾文书文书动而名禄遂，春花燕语燕语喧而喜庆临。 占远信则远信来，叩近谋而近谋遂。 未时第三　神功阴助　中平 窃盗来空室，劳心任往还。 倘非神力助，心致损机关。 偷盗之辈徒生窃害之心，谋陷之中自有神真之护。 谨其身以却其祸灾害不生，守其分以安其福祸乱不作。 未时第四　成济为事　上上 高田百种苗，丰稔庆秋高。 喜得逢甘泽。 农家祝圣尧。 时丰岁念自无水旱之忧，雨顺风调必有秋成之望。 所谋所用之喜如甘雨以济枯苗，所望所求之心如凉风而懈炎热。 未时第五　守真坚恪　中平 松栢傲霜雪，浮花不耐春。 时真存节操，坚恪保安宁。 守真守道之志如松桥而傲雪霜不凋不枯，苟求苟望之人如浮花而敌风雨岂久坚确。 常以存心安，宁自然获福。 未时第六　正心无疑　中平 天外一声雷，风云庆会时。 邪人皆悚慓，正士一皈依。 雷音轰烈警其恶而诛其邪，镜莹诤明照其妍而鉴其配。 心若端正则无疑，道若饭依则无惧。 未时第七　出滞得快　上上 得道人多助，时欣岁又欢。 岂能相阻遏，去路自翱翔。 得道者所以多助天下顺之，守道者所以寡过一身安矣。 出其幽谷飞腾而脱滞趋亨，步其去衢超越而遂心快意。 未时第八　福临灾退　上上 鸾呜鹤舞时，仙仗下天墀。 待赐真光福，灾愆一宥之。 玉佩丁当驾龙车於碧汉，彩云缭绕拥仙仗於瑶空。 真光赫赫扫除天下之妖氛，圣德巍巍普赐阖门之福庆。
chunks.translated_text:
**Twenty-Fifth Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Slander and Flattery Bring Harm – Most Inauspicious**

Flattery’s words are never ordinary,
To engage with them is surely to invite harm.
In darkness hides a sharpened blade—
Take heed, ever be on guard.

The flatterer’s face beams with delight, praising to your face but slandering behind,
The slanderer’s schemes are swift as a knife, sharp as a sword.
Compared to the venom of wasps and scorpions, their poison runs deeper,
Compared to the ferocity of tigers and wolves, their malice is worse.

**Twenty-Fifth Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Dao Aligns and Success Follows – Most Auspicious**

A steed of treasure flies swift as the wind,
Green clouds part to reveal the path ahead.
Plans meet with timely accord—
How could success be long delayed?

The road ahead opens wide, borne on a treasure steed swift as flight,
Steps rise high and free, ascending green clouds to find the way.
Plans align, words are heeded, schemes are followed—
Fortune arrives, the heart grows keen, all things prosper, and fame is achieved.

**Twenty-Sixth Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Beware Slanderous Words – Most Inauspicious**

Fierce fire burns pearls and jade,
Slanderous words destroy the good and kind.
If one cannot quell their wrath,
Nearly they bring danger and harm.

Even the fairest pearls and jade may bear the slightest flaw,
How could the good and kind be free from slander’s defamation?
To dispel slander and silence calumny, one must purify the self and cultivate virtue,
To quell wrath and absolve faults, one must retreat, reflect, and amend.

**Twenty-Seventh Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Efforts Unfulfilled – Most Inauspicious**

Alone beneath the slanting sun,
A fading cicada drinks the evening breeze.
An autumn courtyard lies desolate,
The water clock’s drips have all run dry.

A fading cicada in the slanting sun knows the scene grows bleak,
Falling leaves in the western wind feel autumn’s desolation.
The long night’s drips in dreams become restless slumber,
The heart’s chaos breeds inner turmoil—doubts remain unresolved.

**Twenty-Eighth Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Refined into Excellence – Most Auspicious**

A single leap within the Dragon Gate,
Peach blossoms ride the surging waves.
Now the self finds joy—
Toil and ease have borne their fruit.

The literary arena yields success, repaying diligent resolve,
The Moon Palace’s laurel is grasped, fulfilling years of study.
With determined spirit, the Dragon Gate is leapt—
Crowned among peers, fame spreads far and wide.

**Twenty-Ninth Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Aid and Support Arrive – Most Auspicious**

Day after day, what is sought?
A heart weighed down, its wishes unmet.
Suddenly, another lends their strength—
Hand in hand, they ascend to wander the clouds.

Daily striving brings both fame and virtue to fruition,
The path stretches smooth, granaries overflow with abundance.
Meeting one who offers aid—like a wind that parts the fur,
Encountering great nobility—clouds part to reveal the sun.

**Thirtieth Oracle of the Hour of Wu – Fame and Fortune Unfulfilled – Most Inauspicious**

Wealth scatters in the wind’s wake,
Fame lingers amidst clouds and mist.
Neither fortune nor renown is attained—
Turning back, one shuts the rustic gate.

Treasure lost, buried beneath a thousand leagues of waves,
Rank and title obscured, veiled by a sky of clouds.
Looking back—profit unclaimed, fame unachieved,
Shutting the gate—closed and barred, no passage through.

---

**First Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Prosperity in the Household – Most Auspicious**

Of the five blessings, longevity comes first,
Age advances, emolument extends.
A household gathers auspicious qi,
Young and old rejoice in peace.

Health, peace, wealth, and longevity—all five blessings complete, the world holds one in honor,
Joy and harmony gather in one home, young and old live in harmony.
He who is filial to parents finds the Dao’s aid and the household flourishes,
He who reveres the true sees good fortune cultivated and evil retreat.

**Second Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Fame and Emolument Achieved – Most Auspicious**

A deer-drawn carriage bears urgent documents,
Flowers bloom as swallows chatter.
Spring blossoms bring fulfillment,
Every matter delights in connection.

A deer-drawn carriage sets documents in motion—fame and emolument are achieved,
Spring flowers and swallow calls bring joyous tidings.
Send word afar, and distant news arrives,
Knock on near plans, and near plans succeed.

**Third Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Divine Power’s Hidden Aid – Neutral**

Thieves creep into an empty chamber,
Anxious thoughts come and go.
Were it not for divine aid,
The heart’s schemes would suffer loss.

Those who steal harbor only harm in their hearts,
Yet those who plot find the protection of divine truth.
Guard the self to avert disaster—harm will not arise,
Hold to one’s place to secure fortune—chaos will not stir.

**Fourth Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Success in Affairs – Most Auspicious**

High fields bear a hundred sprouts,
A bountiful harvest celebrates autumn’s height.
Joyfully meeting sweet rains—
Farmers praise the sage-king Yao.

A year of plenty knows no drought or flood,
Seasonal winds and timely rains promise an autumn of abundance.
What is planned and pursued delights like sweet rain reviving withered seedlings,
What is hoped for and sought eases the heart like a cool breeze dispelling summer’s heat.

**Fifth Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Uphold Truth with Unyielding Resolve – Neutral**

Pines and cypresses defy frost and snow,
Fleeting blossoms cannot endure spring.
Hold fast to truth and preserve integrity—
Unyielding resolve ensures peace.

To guard truth and the Dao is like pines and cypresses standing proud in snow, unwithered and unbroken,
To seek without principle is like fleeting blossoms—how can they withstand wind and rain for long?
Ever maintain a steadfast heart—
Peace and fortune will naturally follow.

**Sixth Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Rectify the Heart Without Doubt – Neutral**

A thunderclap beyond the heavens,
Wind and clouds gather in auspicious union.
The wicked tremble in fear,
The upright find refuge in the Dao.

The thunder’s roar warns the evil and punishes the wicked,
The mirror’s clarity illuminates beauty and exposes flaws.
If the heart is upright, there is no doubt,
If the Dao is embraced, there is no fear.

**Seventh Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Emerging from Stagnation with Joy – Most Auspicious**

Those who attain the Dao gain much aid,
The times bring joy, the year brings cheer.
How could they be obstructed?
Their path soars freely.

Those who attain the Dao gain aid—all under heaven follows them,
Those who uphold the Dao avoid faults—the self finds peace.
Emerging from the dark valley, they take flight, shedding stagnation for prosperity,
Striding the open road, they transcend, fulfilling heart’s desire with joy.

**Eighth Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Fortune Arrives, Disaster Retreats – Most Auspicious**

Phoenixes sing, cranes dance,
The immortal’s retinue descends from the celestial steps.
Awaiting the bestowal of true radiance and fortune—
All transgressions are pardoned.

Jade pendants chime as dragon carriages traverse the azure heavens,
Colored clouds swirl, escorting the immortal’s retinue through the jade sky.
True radiance blazes, sweeping away all malevolent vapors under heaven,
Sacred virtue towers, bestowing blessings upon every household.

chunks.original_text: 未时第九　忽然喜合　上上 十一口相扶，相承百事如。 朱衣当引道，闻喜降天书。 忽尔相承事有不期而会合，因时际遇和同众力之扶持。 况贵人生提挈之欢心，主文书有升迁之美意。 未时第十　忧退虑消　中平 三女已消亡，忧情自渺茫。 目前开豁意，身后必嘉祥。 三女亡奸诈自然而屏息，戎具退盗贼顿尔而消除。 蕾买收雾敛心眼有开豁之明，虑散忧除谋用无淹延之滞。 未时十一　利见大人　上上 利泽施于民，欢声化彩云。 尧丰岁时泰，万境贺升平。 圣人德化惠可及於兆民，君子道亨利可泽於天下。 尧年丰瑞一天星斗呈辉，舜日熙和万境欢声诞布。 未时十二　干人有阻　下下 计策已为诈，人情不可干。 再三空进退，喜气变愁颜。 人之情诈口虽诺而心必违，道之乖讹言不从而谋不用。 心殷葱而至恳至切喜庆为忧，事渐懒而无阻无成进而后退。 未时十三　退暗出明　中平 坐久清风发，梦回明月生。 昏昏多少意，方始见分明。 清风徐发涤炎热以清凉，明月初生照幽沉之昏暗。 进一步行途渐稳已有轻便，谋一事径路开通殊无障碍。 未时十四　禳灾谢过　中平 阴小恐生述，闲争事返惊。 桧禳凭道力，香火更留心。 阴小坎坷门庭生不测之迍，闲事喧争名位起不虞之恼。 急须谢过依凭大道之恩光，速可消禳保佑家门之吉庆。 未时十五　忧喜不成　中平 一木见云霓，空花发秀枝。 须臾无一事，忧喜两忘之。 雷雨收顿生霞彩，江海净忽起波涛。 须臾云收霞散更无一点之悲欢，顷刻花谢水流馒有两忘之嗟叹。 未时十六　心速事迟　下下 策马度严关，天昏月又残，主人难进步，惆怅起悲颜。 千里之程非一日而可至可达，迂折之事非片言而可就可成。 漏残月落徒生惆怅之悲，心速事迟谩起呻吟之叹。 未时十七　虚声妄意　下下 有宝隔千山，无言向彼问，闻声名不实，到了事空闲。 妄求之意有如空裹搏风，虚想之心全似水中捉月。 徒取他人窃笑谩劳自己，施为事事无成谋谋何济。 未时十八　忧迍不宁　下下 家中萧索事，动静一成述。 旺气全然灭，人忧鬼亦惊。 兴败顿成於萧索灰冷烟沉，动静恐染於述澶心忧意虑。 守常守分犹防扰扰之非，进望进求恐有忽忽之失。 未时十九　成次未许　下下 见之则未见，成之尚未成。 徘徊空进退，来往枉劳心。 似见不见之形虽离娄而不可睹，似闻不闻之语有师旷而不可听。 既闻见尚未得真，於成败岂能便决。 未时二十　名称俱备　上上 红日照乾坤，嘉祥集孔门。 望中旌表至，声誉世间闻。 红日升天阳气舒而阴气匿，嘉祥集户人道亨而鬼道潜。 德业备而百世流馨，忠节至而一门旌表。 未时二十一　败事复成　上上 红日化严霜，幽潜悉显光。 枯根有生意，渐可发芬芳。 严霜杀物物将败而暖日消融，巨浪飘舟舟欲覆而暴风忽息。 退散之事举用必成，枯朽之根栽培必活。 未时二十二　惊心未宁　下下 霭霭一天云，风雷发震惊。 忧怀无限恨，犹未脱埃尘。 霭霭云生必有迅雷之发，惶惶心动堤防虚诈之惊。 虽不至大难凶危之厄，犹未脱小迍无妄之灾。 未时二十三　事迟有望　中平 大器晚当成，大音希有声。 琢磨方见宝，不枉久劳心。 方鼎之器非一日之可成，百里之雷非无时之有震。 丹砂宿火须凭九转之功，谋事称心切要三思之用。
