**Ninth Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Sudden Joyous Union – Most Auspicious**

Eleven mouths lend support,
A hundred affairs align as if borne by fate.
Crimson-robed guides lead the way,
Auspicious tidings descend in celestial script.

Matters unexpectedly converge, meeting without prior design,
Timely encounters harmonize, strengthened by the aid of many.
Moreover, the joy of noble patrons’ uplifting favor,
And official documents bearing promotions of good intent.

---

**Tenth Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Worries Retreat, Anxieties Dissolve – Neutral**

The three women have vanished,
Anxious thoughts naturally fade into vagueness.
Before one’s eyes, clarity dawns,
And blessings surely follow.

The three women’s deceit dissipates of itself,
Weapons withdraw, bandits vanish in an instant.
Mists disperse, clouds lift—vision clears,
Worries scatter, plans proceed without delay.

---

**Eleventh Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Meeting the Great Person is Auspicious – Most Auspicious**

Blessings bestowed upon the people,
Joyful voices transform into radiant clouds.
Like the prosperous years of Yao,
All realms celebrate peace.

The sage’s virtue and transformation extend to the multitudes,
The noble’s Dao and harmony bring grace to all under heaven.
Like Yao’s bountiful years, stars gleam in the sky,
Like Shun’s bright reign, joy resounds across the land.

---

**Twelfth Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Blocked by Others – Most Inauspicious**

Schemes turn to deceit,
Human sentiments cannot be swayed.
Thrice advancing, thrice retreating in vain,
Joyful countenance shifts to sorrow.

People’s sentiments are false—though their words promise, their hearts oppose,
The Dao’s path diverges—plans are rejected, counsel ignored.
Sincere and earnest pleas turn celebration to grief,
Matters grow sluggish, obstacles arise—progress yields to retreat.

---

**Thirteenth Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Emerging from Darkness into Light – Neutral**

Seated long, a cool breeze arises,
From dreams, the bright moon is born.
How many dim thoughts,
Only now become clear.

The gentle breeze dispels heat, bringing coolness,
The newborn moon illuminates the depths of darkness.
Each step forward finds the path steadier, lighter,
Each endeavor meets an open road, free of obstruction.

---

**Fourteenth Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Averting Disaster, Atoning for Faults – Neutral**

Minor yin fears stir trouble,
Trivial disputes invite alarm.
Rely on the Dao’s power for exorcism,
Devote care to incense and prayers.

Minor misfortunes bring unforeseen setbacks,
Petty conflicts breed unexpected vexations.
Hasten to atone, depending on the great Dao’s radiance,
Swiftly dispel calamity, securing the household’s fortune.

---

**Fifteenth Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Joy and Sorrow Unfulfilled – Neutral**

A lone tree meets clouds and mist,
Empty blossoms sprout on barren branches.
In an instant, nothing remains—
Joy and sorrow both forgotten.

Thunderstorms cease, suddenly giving way to rosy clouds,
Rivers and seas calm, then surge without warning.
In a moment, clouds disperse, mists vanish—no trace of sorrow or joy,
In an instant, flowers wither, waters flow—only sighs of oblivion remain.

---

**Sixteenth Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Hasty Heart, Slow Affairs – Most Inauspicious**

Spurring the horse through a perilous pass,
The sky darkens, the moon wanes.
The master struggles to advance,
Melancholy stirs a mournful face.

A thousand-mile journey cannot be completed in a day,
Tortuous matters cannot be resolved in a single word.
The hour grows late, the moon sets—vain sorrow arises,
The heart races, affairs lag—only groans and sighs remain.

---

**Seventeenth Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Empty Reputation, Vain Intent – Most Inauspicious**

A treasure lies beyond a thousand mountains,
Silent, one turns to inquire of another.
Hearing its name, yet finding no substance,
Upon arrival, all proves idle.

Vain pursuit is like grasping at wind in empty air,
Deluded thoughts are like seizing the moon’s reflection in water.
Others mock in secret, while one’s own efforts are wasted,
Every endeavor fails, every plan comes to naught.

---

**Eighteenth Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Worries and Setbacks, No Peace – Most Inauspicious**

Within the household, desolation reigns,
Every movement and stillness breeds misfortune.
Vital qi wholly extinguished,
People grieve, even ghosts take alarm.

Prosperity collapses into desolation—cold ashes, smoldering embers,
Movement and stillness risk contamination—anxious thoughts, troubled mind.
Hold fast to constancy, guard against disturbance,
Strive forward with caution, lest haste invite loss.

---

**Nineteenth Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Success Still Uncertain – Most Inauspicious**

Seen yet not truly seen,
Achieved yet not truly achieved.
Hesitating, advancing and retreating in vain,
Coming and going, the heart labors in vain.

Forms half-glimpsed are like the blind man’s gaze—unseen,
Words half-heard are like the deaf man’s ear—unheard.
Even what is seen and heard remains uncertain,
How can success or failure be decided?

---

**Twentieth Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Reputation and Virtue Fully Established – Most Auspicious**

The red sun illuminates heaven and earth,
Auspicious omens gather at the gate.
From afar, honors arrive,
Renown spreads across the world.

The red sun ascends—yang qi flourishes, yin qi recedes,
Auspicious signs assemble—human Dao prospers, ghostly ways withdraw.
Virtue and deeds perfected, fragrance lingers for a hundred generations,
Loyalty and integrity supreme, the household is honored.

---

**Twenty-First Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Failing Matters Restored to Success – Most Auspicious**

The red sun melts the harsh frost,
Hidden depths are fully revealed.
Withered roots revive with life,
Gradually, fragrance blooms anew.

Harsh frost kills, yet the warming sun dissolves it,
Mighty waves toss the boat, yet the storm suddenly stills.
Faltering matters, when acted upon, must succeed,
Withered roots, when nurtured, must revive.

---

**Twenty-Second Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Startled Heart, No Peace – Most Inauspicious**

Misty clouds veil the sky,
Wind and thunder strike with sudden shock.
Endless sorrow fills the heart,
Still enmeshed in dust and grime.

Misty clouds gather, foretelling swift thunder,
Anxious hearts tremble, wary of deceit’s alarm.
Though not yet facing great peril or dire misfortune,
One remains entangled in minor setbacks and unforeseen woes.

---

**Twenty-Third Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Delayed Matters Hold Promise – Neutral**

Great vessels take time to complete,
Great sounds are rarely heard.
Only through polishing is treasure revealed,
No effort is wasted in long labor.

The tripod vessel is not forged in a day,
The thunder of a hundred leagues does not sound without cause.
Cinnabar requires the ninefold transmutation of alchemical fire,
To fulfill one’s heart’s desire, careful reflection is essential.

All transgressions are pardoned.

Jade pendants chime as dragon carriages traverse the azure heavens,
Colored clouds swirl, escorting the immortal’s retinue through the jade sky.
True radiance blazes, sweeping away all malevolent vapors under heaven,
Sacred virtue towers, bestowing blessings upon every household.

chunks.original_text: 未时二十四　利见大人　上上 蓬莱路渺茫，仙洞岁时长。 得遇高人面，灵机助玉章。 蓬莱路渺得其道出则何难，仙洞遐长遇其真往则何远。 夙缘契合利干上贵之人，功名照然必感宝章之赐。 未时二十五　萌事未发　中平 残月待时久，机关用处忙，未知成败事，流水去何长。 栽培之木未遇春未可发萌，谋望之心未得时未能成遂。 机关用而未遂空自怆忙，智谋广而无施谩劳心力。 未时二十六　福实事厚　上上 历古至于今，金刚玉石身。 任他霜雪凛，不改岁寒心。 一鱼金琢玉乃成至宝之珍，植桧栽松何异雪霜之凛。 禄厚者虽火水不能有伤，道成者纵邪魔安敢相逼。 未时二十七　守节安吉　上上 贯道守于一，持心不在狂。 坐中当见事，笑默意何长。 有道之士守其一而不乱，存心之人持其志而不回，静默虚恬则养浩然之气，谦恭端谨则无暴慢之非。 未时二十八　解怨成惧　上上 千里遇知心，一天风月清，怨情今已解，烂熳醉惧听。 结怨者自种今生之祸患，施恩者必招宿世之因缘。 怨情既解一天风月澄清，好既重临千里恩烂慢。 未时二十九　待事如旦　中平 夜月照庭除，清狈一啸孤。 待须平旦日，方可去登途。 狈啼悄悄徒劳枕上之思，月影沉沉空役梦中之想。 候得时而进用事必晓然，待平旦以登途路无阻碍。 未时三十　危中有救　上上 狂浪欲覆舟，忧虑不胜愁。 须臾临彼岸，新庆满高楼。 波狂浪急舟欲覆而事欲危，风定浪收船始安而心始泰。 临彼岸已离危险天地扶持，上高楼而庆新华人物丰美。 玄真灵应宝签卷中竟 玄直灵应宝签卷下

**Twenty-Fourth Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Auspicious to Meet a Great Person – Most Auspicious**

The path to Penglai stretches distant and obscure,
The immortal’s grotto endures through the ages.
Should one encounter the countenance of a noble soul,
Divine insight shall aid the jade tablet’s decree.

The road to Penglai, though remote, yields no difficulty when the Dao is found;
The immortal’s cave, though far, presents no distance when the true one is met.
Predestined affinity aligns with the favor of exalted and noble figures,
Merit and fame shall shine forth, assured by the gift of the sacred talisman.

---

**Twenty-Fifth Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Matters Remain Dormant – Neutral**

The waning moon awaits its time in stillness,
Schemes and devices keep one endlessly occupied.
Yet the outcome of success or failure remains unknown,
As flowing waters drift ever onward.

A nurtured tree, unmet by spring, cannot yet sprout;
A heart’s design, untouched by fortune, cannot yet come to pass.
Mechanisms set in motion yet unfulfilled—vainly one rushes in distress;
Wisdom and plans, though vast, find no outlet—futilely one wearies the mind.

---

**Twenty-Sixth Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Blessings Abound, Affairs Prosper – Most Auspicious**

From ancient times to the present,
A body like gold and jade endures.
Though frost and snow may chill,
The heart of winter’s constancy remains unchanged.

A fish carved of gold and jade becomes a treasure of supreme worth;
Planted cypress and pines stand firm against the biting frost.
Those blessed with abundant fortune cannot be harmed by fire or flood;
Those who have attained the Dao dare not be assailed by evil forces.

---

**Twenty-Seventh Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Uphold Integrity, Secure Peace – Most Auspicious**

Hold fast to the Dao, steadfast in the One,
Maintain the heart without recklessness.
Seated, one perceives all matters clearly,
Silent laughter lingers long in the mind.

The person of the Dao abides in the One without confusion;
The one who cultivates the heart holds to their resolve without wavering.
In stillness and emptiness, one nurtures the vast qi;
In humility and reverence, one avoids arrogance and impropriety.

---

**Twenty-Eighth Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Resolve Grievances, Transform Fear – Most Auspicious**

A thousand leagues away, one meets a kindred spirit,
The sky’s wind and moon turn clear.
The grievance now dissolved,
Joyous and carefree, one listens to the music of delight.

Those who sow enmity reap calamity in this life;
Those who bestow kindness summon the causes of past lives.
Once grievances are resolved, the wind and moon of the heavens grow serene;
Goodness returns anew, and a thousand leagues away, grace overflows.

---

**Twenty-Ninth Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Await the Dawn – Neutral**

The moonlit night illuminates the courtyard,
A lone ape’s mournful cry echoes.
Wait for the break of day,
Then set forth upon the journey.

The ape’s plaintive wails vainly stir thoughts upon the pillow;
The moon’s sinking shadow idly stirs dreams in the night.
Await the right moment to advance—affairs shall surely brighten;
Wait for dawn to set forth—no obstacles shall block the path.

---

**Thirtieth Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Salvation in Peril – Most Auspicious**

Raging waves threaten to capsize the boat,
Anxiety and sorrow know no end.
In an instant, one reaches the far shore,
New joys fill the lofty tower.

Waves surge, the boat teeters on the brink of peril;
Wind subsides, the vessel steadies, and the heart finds peace.
Upon reaching the far shore, danger is left behind—heaven and earth lend aid;
Ascending the high tower, one celebrates renewal—people and fortunes flourish.

---

*The Mysterious and True, Spirit-Responsive Precious Oracle, Middle Scroll – Concluded*
*The Mysterious and True, Spirit-Responsive Precious Oracle, Final Scroll*

**Twenty-Third Oracle of the Hour of Wei – Delayed Matters Hold Promise – Neutral**

Great vessels take time to complete,
Great sounds are rarely heard.
Only through polishing is treasure revealed,
No effort is wasted in long labor.

The tripod vessel is not forged in a day,
The thunder of a hundred leagues does not sound without cause.
Cinnabar requires the ninefold transmutation of alchemical fire,
To fulfill one’s heart’s desire, careful reflection is essential.

chunks.original_text: 申时第一　待时可时　平平 渺渺天边鹄，乘风万里飞。 更无霜雪阻，秋色满庭帏。 天边之鹄风力健则飞达云霄，尘世中人命运通则显荣超遂，时未遂则潜而勿用，命运通则守而自亨。 申时第二　得意遇时　上上 皓月洞庭秋，乘鸾汗漫游。 玉壶天地阔，已脱苦淹留。 明月清风况对洞庭之秋色，乘鸾跨鹤何妨汗浸之清游。 玉壶洁净更无半点嚣尘，仙洞遐长已绝有为之快乐。 申时第三　喜信临门　上上 火炼始成金，真光现宝庭。 骇然为一信，忽尔报佳音。 烹金琢玉乃成大宝之珍，炼性修真必有升仙之分。 佳音至天降异常之喜庆，美信临人生踊跃之欢欣。 申时第四　佳报奇遇　上上 灿然星斗交，宝剑气凌云。 别有真奇遇，终身满国闻。 宝剑凌空上彻斗牛之色，旌忠辅国下镇夷狄之威。 一时际遇遇则峥嵘，千里播闻闻则超遂。 申时第五　望事不成　下下 玉碎不成琢，金潜岂可烹。 惜哉奇遇士，迤逦暗中行。 玉簪将就已成中折之悲，执钓得鱼忽有折钩之叹。 因缘事遇而不遇一笑而空，谋望事成中不成中辍而止。 申时第六　次疑成事　中平 水清鱼可见，智明情不知。 幸无昏浊昧，何用强猜疑。 水中静则游鱼可见，智内敏则情伪可知。 既无蒙昧之欺当次狐疑之虑，举一事须成就谋一用须去疑。 申时第七　守道勿用　中平 大道本无碍，真光照眼明。 守心能守正，神鬼亦须惊。 大道无名本无拘无碍，真光有象可能照能明。 心若正直神不干而鬼不欺，性若圆通仙可学而佛可作。 申时第八　恼事渐消　中平 群心乱生忿，众心空忧牵。 从他机巧用，举步自安然。 僭乱者必遭君子之刑，忿争者必受小人之辱。 人事乖违众情不顺久而自消，心意隐忍百病不侵久而自泰。 申时第九　退忧成喜　上上 赫赫阳光发，沉沉鬼魅消。 满怀幽兴盛，一扫意超超。 日升天则阴邪自然潜匿，命运通则灾害自然消除。 纵生戚戚之忧怀，当有欣欣之美遇。 申时第十　守正戒非　中平 人头三尺上，神物自相随。 昧事休生意，防心切自持。 天虽高而听甚卑，神虽幽面察甚明。 意欲妄举岂无暗录之愆尤，心宜自防必有明彰之福报。 申时十一　忧散成喜　上上 风月满高楼，提拥可恣游。 开眉展愁腹，樽酒醉方休。 楼台风月正堪良夜之欢，身世康和勿负佳期之约。 散忧怀於物外眉展心宽，列樽俎於席前欢天乐地。 申时十二　得禄有望　上上 天禄赐尧阶，丹书降玉台。 欣然无限意，花向故园开。 尧阶赐禄得瞻天地之恩光，故圃花开复赏芳华之景色。 职位有欣欣之喜庆，家门无坎坎之非虞。 申时十三　危中有赦　上上 赢疾自夭降，昏迷日醉沉。 忽逢天上士，宝饵赐玄灵。 颠危之事恰如病在於膏肓，迷乱之心何异醉沉於酩酊。 非扶持不可以救困济危，非妙药不可以却灾疗病。 申时十四　迷中有指　上上 寒灰气已消，志识更飘飘。 得遇至人语，分明指路遥。 至人妙语顿开迷悟之心。 长者提拥指引亨途大道。 寒灰域烬余焰复燃，枯木凋零旧枝再茂。 申时十五　谨身防失　下下 朽索御六马，常须谨步行。 倘然微纵放，必致祸临身。 卒暴之性岂无颠蹶之危，朽败之绳焉击奔冲之马。 性纵逸而招祸必累其身，心警惧以免殃方成其福。 申时十六　举措宜谨　中平

**First Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Awaiting the Right Time – Average**

A lone crane soars at the edge of the sky,
Riding the wind for ten thousand miles.
No frost or snow shall block its way,
Autumn’s hues fill the courtyard’s veil.

The crane at the sky’s edge—when the wind is strong, it soars to the clouds;
The mortal in the world—when fate flows, glory and success arise.
If the time is not yet ripe, remain hidden and do not act;
When fate aligns, abide in stillness and all shall prosper.

---

**Second Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Success in Due Time – Most Auspicious**

Bright moon over Dongting’s autumn,
Riding the phoenix in boundless flight.
A jade flask holds the vastness of heaven and earth,
Freed at last from bitter delay.

The bright moon and clear wind complement Dongting’s autumn hues;
Riding the phoenix or crane, why not wander in carefree delight?
The jade flask is pure, untouched by even a speck of dust;
The immortal’s cave is distant, far from worldly joys.

---

**Third Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Joyous Tidings at the Door – Most Auspicious**

Fire refines gold to perfection,
True radiance appears in the hall of treasures.
Startled by a single message,
Sudden glad tidings arrive.

Smelting gold and carving jade yield the rarest treasures;
Cultivating nature and refining the true self must lead to ascension.
Joyous news descends from heaven—extraordinary blessings;
Glorious tidings arrive—leaping with exultation.

---

**Fourth Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Wondrous Encounter – Most Auspicious**

Stars and constellations gleam in splendor,
The sword’s qi soars to the clouds.
A rare and wondrous encounter,
Brings lifelong fame throughout the land.

The precious sword pierces the heavens, its brilliance reaching the stars;
Loyalty and service to the realm quell the might of barbarian tribes.
A single timely encounter—towering achievement;
A thousand miles of renown—unmatched success.

---

**Fifth Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Hopes Unfulfilled – Most Inauspicious**

Jade shatters before it can be carved,
Hidden gold cannot be smelted.
Alas for the seeker of rare fortune,
Who wanders in darkness, step by step.

The jade hairpin, nearly complete, snaps in sorrow;
The fisherman, having hooked his catch, sighs as the line breaks.
Circumstance meets yet does not meet—laughter fades into emptiness;
Plans and hopes, half-realized, end in abandonment.

---

**Sixth Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Doubt Clouds Success – Average**

Clear water reveals the fish,
Wisdom sees through deceit.
Fortunately, no murky confusion,
Why force needless suspicion?

Still waters reveal the swimming fish;
A sharp mind discerns truth from falsehood.
Without the fog of ignorance, set aside needless doubt;
In every matter, proceed with resolve and cast aside hesitation.

---

**Seventh Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Abide in the Dao, Do Not Act – Average**

The Great Dao knows no obstruction,
True light illuminates the eyes.
Guard the heart and uphold integrity,
Even spirits and ghosts must stand in awe.

The Great Dao is nameless—unbound and free;
True light is formless—able to illuminate and clarify.
If the heart is upright, spirits will not interfere nor ghosts deceive;
If the nature is complete, immortality may be learned and Buddhahood attained.

---

**Eighth Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Troubles Gradually Fade – Average**

Many hearts breed resentment,
Crowds cling to empty worries.
Let them scheme and plot,
Each step shall be at ease.

Usurpers shall face the gentleman’s judgment;
The wrathful shall endure the petty man’s disgrace.
Worldly affairs may clash, and emotions may not align—yet in time, all shall fade;
Patience and restraint keep illness at bay—peace comes with endurance.

---

**Ninth Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Sorrow Turns to Joy – Most Auspicious**

The sun’s radiance blazes forth,
Dark spirits vanish in its glow.
A heart brimming with hidden delight,
All cares swept away in an instant.

When the sun ascends, yin and evil naturally retreat;
When fate flows smoothly, disasters dissolve of their own accord.
Though sorrow may weigh heavily,
Joyous fortune shall surely arrive.

---

**Tenth Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Uphold Integrity, Shun Wrongdoing – Average**

Above the three-foot crown of man,
Divine beings ever attend.
Do not entertain deceitful schemes,
Guard the heart and hold fast.

Though heaven is high, its hearing is keen;
Though spirits are hidden, their sight is clear.
To act recklessly is to invite unseen transgressions;
To guard the heart is to secure manifest blessings.

---

**Eleventh Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Sorrow Disperses, Joy Arrives – Most Auspicious**

Wind and moon fill the high tower,
Embrace the night and wander freely.
Brows unfurrow, worries unburdened,
Wine flows until drunkenness brings rest.

The tower’s wind and moon befit a night of revelry;
Health and harmony—do not waste this auspicious hour.
Cast sorrows beyond the world, let brows relax and hearts expand;
Arrange the feast, let joy reign under heaven and earth.

---

**Twelfth Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Official Emolument in Sight – Most Auspicious**

Heavenly emolument bestowed upon Yao’s steps,
A vermilion decree descends from the jade terrace.
Boundless joy fills the heart,
Flowers bloom in the old garden.

Yao’s steps receive emolument—bathed in heaven and earth’s grace;
The old garden’s flowers bloom—reveling in fragrant splendor.
Office brings joy upon joy;
The household knows no misfortune or fear.

---

**Thirteenth Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Pardon in Peril – Most Auspicious**

Illness strikes like a sudden affliction,
Drunkenness deepens day by day.
Suddenly, a celestial being appears,
Bestowing the elixir of divine spirit.

Perilous circumstances resemble a disease in the vital organs;
A confused mind differs little from drunken stupor.
Without support, how can one be rescued from distress?
Without miraculous medicine, how can disaster be averted?

---

**Fourteenth Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Guidance in Confusion – Most Auspicious**

The embers of cold ash fade,
Will and perception drift like the wind.
Then, the words of a true person,
Clearly point the distant path.

The true person’s wisdom dispels the heart’s confusion;
The elder’s guidance directs the way to prosperity.
Cold ash’s last embers may rekindle;
Withered wood’s old branches may flourish anew.

---

**Fifteenth Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Caution Against Loss – Most Inauspicious**

A rotting rope guides six horses,
One must tread carefully at every step.
Should the slightest laxity arise,
Disaster shall surely strike.

A violent temper risks stumbling and peril;
A frayed rope cannot restrain galloping steeds.
Indulgence invites calamity upon oneself;
Vigilance averts misfortune and secures fortune.

---

**Sixteenth Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Prudence in Action – Average**

chunks.original_text: 百尺高竿险，休宜纵此心。 行藏须把捉，方许得安平。 登崖虽险常怀惧亦不致危，平地虽安纵放性岂不招祸。 谋望事未成未许役志劳心，行藏事始吉始安修身养命。 申时十七　谨身守正　中平 万顷清江静，一天星斗寒。 扁舟行正道，谨惧渡波澜。 谨身谨行不可少顷离，守正守心不可铨步失。 不谨不畏澄江忽起於风波，违正道必诚玉自投於水火。 申时十八　旧币重新　上上 一喜自天降，庭帏起寿萱。 岂知残户牖，复尔再新垣。 重开户牖鼎新革固之时，再整墙垣修弊补残之意。 谋新理旧二事皆可谐同，望禄求名一喜俱能称遂。 申时十九　劳中有逸　上上 早鱼方得水，病虎入山林。 渐渐有生意，悠悠快尔情。 放旱鱼而入深渊洋洋得意，纵病虎而归岩穴渐渐生威。 劳役者有纵逸之期，勤险者有丰饶之望。 申时二十　先难后遂　上上 百战事多危，功成凯乐归。 锦衣回故里，勋业事高弥。 不祥之器孔子号曰佳兵，决胜之谋孙子言日妙计。 功成勋就先经百战之危，衣锦凯旋次受封侯之赏。 申时二十一　感真遇贵　上上 九转灵丹药，三山玉掌仙。 一时来降集，灾散福绵绵。 灵丹九转服之者羽化登仙，蓬岛三山到之者逍遥快乐。 玄真降集福庆保於家门，高贵提携名禄登於爵位。 申时二十二　忍忿待时　中平 击鼠虽防器，触邪仍避真。 不宜先忿躁，徒恃可成名。 鼠临玉器之傍击之者必损其宝，语犯恶人之怒触之者必害其身。 能隐忍忿事自消，若待时谋事自遂。 申时二十三　大成小吉　上上 楚玉逢良识，真金炼得烹。 已能成大器，不碍小忿争。 黄金白璧因烹琢而能成宝，贤才君子怀学业而可成名。 良谋得遂大器所以晚成，美事既修小忿何能侵碍。 申时二十四　谢恩得禄　上上 小禄尚徘徊，东君意已随。 愿将香火信，遥达上天知。 徘徊者必有进退之心，东君者已得提拥之意。 廉谨守节禄永而职可升，香火严恭神可扶而真可助。 申时二十五　举语可成　上上 照胆观心事，明明自可知。 君能开一语，攀接两相随。 忠心义胆天可察而神可知，妄意邪谋鬼必祸而神必斜。 既寸心坦然无忧无谄，若一语合矣可顺可从。 申时二十六　此急彼缓　中平 此望若思渴，彼情如蹈渊。 忽然风雨霁，飘驾上青天。 大旱望霖未有滂雾之甘泽，急趋迷径正当差跌之多岐。 此心急如悬鼓而待槌，彼意缓若停暮而思着。 申时二十七　难中有救　上上 一夕风涛起，舟人意不生。 赖他心力助，道德复全亨。 乘舟行水暴风作而波浪弥天，处世立身狂悖兴则功名扫地。 拔患难乃神真之助力，获安泰缘道德之崇修。 申时二十八　虑心渐解　中平 有意自生忧，无缘脱滞留。 但能安意志，何事不相周。 忧疑出於萦惑虑起千端，幽滞在於淹延愁生百种。 安其意则狐疑渐次而释，宁其心则悔过迤逦自消。 申时二十九　望事返覆 一志苦相执，狂心殊不知。 待他成计日，反覆已经时。 执迷之志将为必取之功，指拟之心却乃虚无之失。 待他者空有悬悬之望进退再三，经时者殊无肯肯之心反复不一。 申时三十　求信有成　上上 雁信欲通传，诚心利后先。 上人能一语，美事十分全。 雁足鱼腹能传千里之书，良语诚心可助十全之美。 占远信信不虚传传无谲诈，谒上人人受实惠惠有恩光。

**Seventeenth Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Prudence in Conduct – Average**

A hundred-foot pole stands perilous;
One must not indulge the heart’s whims.
In action and retreat, hold fast,
Only then may peace and safety be secured.

Though climbing cliffs be treacherous, with constant caution one avoids danger;
Though level ground be safe, indulgence invites calamity.
When schemes and hopes remain unfulfilled, do not exhaust mind and will;
When deeds begin auspiciously, tend to body and nurture life.

---

**Eighteenth Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Renewal of the Old – Most Auspicious**

A thousand acres of limpid river lie still,
The sky’s stars shiver with cold.
A lone boat follows the true path,
Cautious and vigilant, it crosses the waves.

In conduct and bearing, not a moment’s lapse;
In integrity and heart, not a step astray.
Without caution or reverence, the clear river stirs with wind and waves;
Departing from the true path, jade is cast into fire and water.

---

**Nineteenth Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Renewal of the Old – Most Auspicious**

Joy descends from heaven,
In the courtyard, the fragrant daylily blooms with longevity.
Who would know the ruined doors and windows,
Are restored anew, walls rebuilt.

Reopening doors and windows, renewing and fortifying the old;
Repairing walls, mending what is broken and worn.
Renewing the old and ordering the new—both may harmonize,
Hopes for emolument and fame—one joy brings all to fulfillment.

---

**Twentieth Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Ease After Toil – Most Auspicious**

The parched fish finds water,
The ailing tiger returns to the mountain forest.
Gradually, life stirs,
Leisurely, joy fills the heart.

Release the drought-stricken fish into the deep abyss—it thrives with delight;
Free the sickly tiger to its rocky lair—it regains its prowess.
For those who toil, there comes a time of ease;
For those who endure hardship, prosperity awaits.

---

**Twenty-First Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Hardship Followed by Success – Most Auspicious**

A hundred battles bring many perils,
Yet triumphant, one returns in joy.
Broidered robes grace the homeward journey,
Merit and achievement rise ever higher.

The inauspicious weapon Confucius called "fine warfare";
The decisive strategy Sunzi deemed "masterful planning."
Merit achieved, honors won—first through a hundred battles’ peril;
Returning in broidered robes, next comes the reward of enfeoffment.

---

**Twenty-Second Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Encounter with the True and Noble – Most Auspicious**

Nine-times-refined elixir,
Immortals of the Three Mountains, jade-handed.
All descend in this moment,
Disaster scatters, fortune unfurls.

The nine-times-refined elixir—those who consume it ascend as immortals;
The Three Isles of Penglai—those who reach them wander in bliss.
The mysterious and true descend, blessing the household with fortune;
The noble extend their aid, raising one to rank and emolument.

---

**Twenty-Third Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Restraint and Timing – Average**

Strike the rat, yet guard the vessel;
Confront the wicked, yet avoid the true.
Do not rush in anger,
Relying on force will not bring renown.

A rat near jade—strike it, and the treasure is damaged;
Words that provoke the wicked—touch them, and the self is harmed.
To endure and restrain anger is to let matters dissolve;
To await the right moment is to let affairs succeed.

---

**Twenty-Fourth Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Great Achievement, Minor Fortune – Most Auspicious**

Chu jade meets a discerning eye,
True gold is smelted and refined.
Already a great vessel is formed,
Small quarrels cannot hinder it.

Yellow gold and white jade, through refining, become treasures;
The worthy and the noble, through learning, achieve renown.
A sound plan comes to fruition—great vessels take time to complete;
Fine deeds are cultivated—how can petty grievances intrude?

---

**Twenty-Fifth Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Gratitude and Emolument – Most Auspicious**

A modest emolument lingers,
Yet the Eastern Lord’s favor follows.
Offer incense and faith,
To reach the heavens above.

To linger is to waver between advance and retreat;
The Eastern Lord has already shown favor.
With integrity and prudence, emolument endures and office rises;
With reverence in ritual, spirits lend aid, and the true assist.

---

**Twenty-Sixth Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Words That Seal Success – Most Auspicious**

Illuminate the gall, observe the heart’s affairs,
All becomes clear and known.
Should you speak but one word,
Two will follow in accord.

Loyalty and righteous gall—heaven sees, spirits know;
Deceit and wicked schemes—ghosts bring misfortune, spirits turn away.
With a heart sincere and free of deceit,
A single fitting word brings compliance and accord.

---

**Twenty-Seventh Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Urgency and Delay – Average**

This hope is like thirst,
That intent like treading an abyss.
Suddenly, wind and rain clear,
A swift chariot ascends the blue heavens.

In great drought, one longs for rain, yet no sweet mist falls;
In haste, one strays from the path, stumbling at every turn.
This heart is urgent as a drum awaiting the mallet;
That intent is slow as dusk settling into stillness.

---

**Twenty-Eighth Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Deliverance from Peril – Most Auspicious**

A storm rises in the evening,
The boatman’s hope seems lost.
Yet another’s strength and virtue aid,
The Dao is restored, all prospers.

Aboard a boat on the water, a violent wind stirs waves to the heavens;
In life and conduct, recklessness brings ruin to merit and name.
Deliverance from peril comes by the aid of the true and divine;
Peace and prosperity stem from the cultivation of virtue and the Dao.

---

**Twenty-Ninth Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Anxiety Gradually Eases – Average**

Intentions breed worry,
Without cause, one lingers in stagnation.
Yet if the will is steadied,
What matter cannot be resolved?

Worry and doubt arise from entanglement, a thousand concerns take shape;
Obscurity and delay stem from procrastination, a hundred sorrows arise.
Calm the intent, and suspicions gradually dissolve;
Compose the heart, and regrets slowly fade.

---

**Thirtieth Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Hopes Turn and Twist – Average**

A single will clings stubbornly,
The reckless heart knows not its folly.
Waiting for another’s plan to take shape,
Time passes in reversal and change.

A stubborn will seeks certain success;
A presumptuous heart meets empty loss.
Waiting for another brings vain hopes, hesitation and delay;
Time passes, yet no firm resolve emerges, shifting without end.

---

**Thirty-First Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Fulfillment Through Sincerity – Most Auspicious**

A wild goose’s message seeks to reach,
Sincerity benefits before and after.
A single word from the superior,
Brings perfect fulfillment to fine affairs.

The goose’s foot, the fish’s belly—messages traverse a thousand miles;
Good words and sincerity aid perfect success.
A distant message, true and unfeigned, carries no deceit;
Approaching the superior, all receive true favor, blessings shine with grace.

**Fifteenth Oracle of the Hour of Shen – Caution Against Loss – Most Inauspicious**

A rotting rope guides six horses,
One must tread carefully at every step.
Should the slightest laxity arise,
Disaster shall surely strike.

A violent temper risks stumbling and peril;
A frayed rope cannot restrain galloping steeds.
Indulgence invites calamity upon oneself;
Vigilance averts misfortune and secures fortune.

---

chunks.original_text: 酉时第一　谨身勿纵　中平 仙友在重关，千山与万山。 谨心乃谨事，欢笑勿追攀。 访朋求友不劳涉水登山，养性修真先要戒贪绝欲。 心宜常谨谨则无失无忧，意当去奢奢则不固不逊。 酉时第二　有路可进　中平 有径不相阻，无门不可关。 非为他妄作，千涉事须烦。 屈曲之径非盘折则不可通，宛转之求非周旋则不可就。 事再三而方遂勿惮其烦。 意进退而始周即非其妄。 酉时第三　悖理有吝　下下 理财理事迟，鬼贼见其机。 勿共同心事，防言变是非。 理财理事财不利而事不成，理讼理婚讼有亏而婚有破。 况鬼贼侵欺而有阴谋之逼，防语言变诈而成屈曲之非。 酉时第四　谨防小人　下下 彼意有所害，此心殊未然。 更防樽俎上，外事恐相牵。 彼畜害我之意言且和而貌且恭，我无防彼之心行不知而坐不察。 防杯欢而生仇怨，戒僭易而恐牵连。 酉时第五　失驭生迍　下下 玉石不可炼，丹砂不可沉，倘非当处用，宝器不全真。 玉石至美不可火炼水烹，心虽至明不可无惧无忧。 失驭则骏奔远迩难追，纵放则迷逸颠危难返。 酉时第六　弃利远害　中平 旧事不宜举，举之必被连。 目前当弃舍，身后得家传。 既往之事不可举举则返害其身，锋刃之蜜不可尝尝则必伤其舌。 弃其小利大事必成，利其下人上情必顺。 酉时第七　静守防心　中平 天外月华清，云中有鸦呜。 寂然无一事，不可举私心。 静其心六贼不动五蕴皆空，防其心百魔自潜三毒消灭。 狼虎虽曰猛兽由可诛擒，善恶出自於心自宜降伏。 酉时第八　轻信寡诺　下下 宿诺几千番，徒劳反覆间。 面前虽笑许，心复事多般。 所恳所求之事虽至切而至勤，所允所许之言却多虚而多伪。 卑辞厚礼此徒费於精神，谄笑迂谈彼常饰其奸诈。 酉时第九　先劳先遂　中平 二子本一事，两情刚更推。 鼠牛相促迫，虎兔见熙熙。 二人同其心者义可分金，二人异其志者事无协济。 子丑发用正当役役之劳心，寅卯合辰方有熙熙之喜色。 酉时第十　先详次用　中平 行步先防险，乘舟预备风。 岂宜仓卒辩，不必问穷通。 事无巨细宜三思而后行，动有吉凶当宾详而始用。 趋行步走犹防颠险之危，求利图名焉可仓卒而辩。 酉时十一　疑事勿用　中平 幽昧未能知，求名叩圣机。 自宜生揣分，疑事不须为。 幽暗者不明之象人莫可知，疑惑者昏乱之端神不可晓。 揣分弃而勿用用则难谐，待时必自有通通则可久。 酉时十二　怨解俨释　中平 夙昔有嫌疑，兹来怨释非。 不须多忌讳，仍以礼和之 小嫌不除将有大怨，小怨不解将成大争。 嫌疑之意非自释不能宽其心，忿争之端非隐忍不能和其怨。 酉时十三　遇事可求　中平 幽室有淹愁，人生水上沤，逢春须得遇，休且强迟留。 人生处世如水上之轻呕，谋事未周若困居於幽室。 得遇阳春少展永淹之志，幸逢良便休更强自迟留。 酉时十四　欲速上迟　中平 听闻唯未见，遇否尚难知。 欲进非能向，从他意所为。 千里传闻多有虚而少有实，一时遇否难所信以难所知。 事欲达尚未可达，心欲速尚未可速。 酉时十五　进禄可升　上上 天地降洪恩，人神共仰钦。 光华归有道，仰视福来临。 天地恩隆辅有道而助有德，人神钦慕仰无愧而俯无惭。 禄位进升共庆重重之喜，官班迁转拜瞻迭迭之荣。

**First Oracle of the Hour of You – Guard the Self, Do Not Indulge – Moderate**

A Daoist friend stands at the double pass,
A thousand mountains, ten thousand mountains lie ahead.
Guard the heart, and affairs are guarded;
In joy and laughter, do not cling or chase.

Seeking friends and companions requires no toil of crossing waters or climbing peaks;
Cultivating nature and refining the true begins with cutting off greed and severing desire.
The heart should ever be guarded—guarded, then no loss, no sorrow;
The mind should cast off excess—excess cast off, then neither obstinate nor overbearing.

---

**Second Oracle of the Hour of You – A Path to Advance – Moderate**

A trail is not blocked,
No gate cannot be closed.
Not acting recklessly for others,
Yet affairs must still be tended with care.

A winding path, unless it twists and turns, cannot be traversed;
A roundabout pursuit, without circling and maneuvering, cannot be achieved.
Affairs may take two or three attempts before success—do not shrink from the trouble;
The mind advances and retreats with due consideration—this is no reckless act.

---

**Third Oracle of the Hour of You – Defying Reason Brings Regret – Most Inauspicious**

Managing wealth and affairs lags,
Ghosts and thieves see their chance.
Do not share matters of one heart,
Beware of words that twist right and wrong.

Managing wealth and affairs—wealth brings no profit, affairs no success;
Handling lawsuits and marriages—lawsuits suffer loss, marriages break.
Moreover, ghosts and thieves press with hidden schemes;
Beware of words turning to deceit, becoming crooked wrongs.

---

**Fourth Oracle of the Hour of You – Beware of Petty Men – Most Inauspicious**

His intent harbors harm,
This heart remains unaware.
Beware still at the feast,
Lest outside affairs entangle you.

He nurses harm toward me—his words are gentle, his face respectful;
I remain heedless—my actions unguarded, my seat unobservant.
Beware of joy in cups turning to enmity,
Guard against presumption, fearing entanglements.

---

**Fifth Oracle of the Hour of You – Losing Control Brings Misfortune – Most Inauspicious**

Jade and stone cannot be smelted,
Cinnabar cannot be sunk.
If not used where they belong,
Even treasures lose their true worth.

Jade and stone, most fine, cannot endure fire or boiling water;
The heart, though most clear, cannot be without caution or care.
Losing control, the swift steed bolts—near or far, hard to retrieve;
Indulging recklessness, the lost stray—stumbling, perilous to return.

---

**Sixth Oracle of the Hour of You – Abandon Gain, Avoid Harm – Moderate**

Old matters should not be raised,
Raising them brings entanglement.
Cast them aside for now,
And your descendants will inherit the family legacy.

Past affairs must not be revived—reviving them brings harm upon oneself;
The honey on a blade’s edge must not be tasted—tasting it surely wounds the tongue.
Abandon small gains, and great affairs will surely succeed;
Profit the subordinates, and the superior’s favor will surely follow.

---

**Seventh Oracle of the Hour of You – Stillness Guards the Heart – Moderate**

Beyond the heavens, the moon’s brilliance is clear,
Amid the clouds, a crow cries.
In stillness, not a single affair stirs,
Do not let private desires arise.

Still the heart—the six thieves do not stir, the five aggregates are empty;
Guard the heart—a hundred demons vanish of themselves, the three poisons fade.
Though wolves and tigers are fierce beasts, they too can be captured and subdued;
Good and evil arise from the heart—it is there they must be mastered.

---

**Eighth Oracle of the Hour of You – Light Trust, Few Promises – Most Inauspicious**

A thousand past promises,
Labor in vain through endless turns.
Though smiling assent is given before your face,
The heart harbors many other schemes.

Matters entreated and sought may be most earnest and diligent,
Yet words promised and pledged are often false and deceitful.
Humble words and lavish gifts waste only spirit and strength;
Flattering smiles and meandering talk are but their cunning disguises.

---

**Ninth Oracle of the Hour of You – First Toil, First Success – Moderate**

Two are of one matter,
Yet both hearts push and vie.
Rat and Ox press urgently,
Tiger and Hare meet with joy.

Two of one heart—righteousness may divide gold;
Two of differing minds—affairs find no cooperation.
Rat and Ox in use bring toiling labor of the heart;
Tiger and Hare in harmony bear the glad countenance of joy.

---

**Tenth Oracle of the Hour of You – First Examine, Then Act – Moderate**

Each step guards against danger,
Boarding a boat, prepare for wind.
How can one rush to decide?
No need to ask of success or failure.

Matters great or small should be pondered thrice before acting;
Movement, whether auspicious or ill, must be carefully weighed before use.
Hastening on foot, one still guards against stumbling peril;
Seeking profit or fame—how can one rush to judgment?

---

**Eleventh Oracle of the Hour of You – Doubtful Matters, Do Not Act – Moderate**

The obscure cannot be known,
Seeking fame, knock at the sage’s gate.
One should weigh and discern,
Doubtful matters need not be pursued.

Obscurity is the sign of the unknowable—none can fathom it;
Doubt is the beginning of confusion—spirits cannot clarify it.
Weigh and abandon—do not act, for acting brings discord;
Wait for the time, and it will naturally open—opening, it may endure.

---

**Twelfth Oracle of the Hour of You – Resentment Dissolves, Grudges Release – Moderate**

Long-held suspicions,
Now resentment fades, grievances cease.
No need for excessive caution,
Meet with courtesy and harmony.

Small grudges unremoved breed great resentment;
Small resentments unresolved lead to great strife.
Suspicious thoughts cannot be eased without self-release;
Contentious beginnings cannot be reconciled without forbearance.

---

**Thirteenth Oracle of the Hour of You – Encountering Affairs, Seek Favor – Moderate**

In a secluded chamber, sorrow lingers,
Life on water—a fleeting bubble.
Meeting spring, one must seize the chance,
Do not stubbornly delay.

Life in the world is like a bubble on water;
Plans unfulfilled are like confinement in a dim room.
Meeting the spring of opportunity, one may yet unfold long-stifled aspirations;
Fortunate to find a favorable turn, do not insist on lingering.

---

**Fourteenth Oracle of the Hour of You – Haste Desires Slow Progress – Moderate**

Heard but not seen,
Whether met or not remains unknown.
Desiring advance, yet unable to move,
Leave it to the will of others.

Rumors from a thousand miles are often false, rarely true;
Whether one meets or not at this moment is hard to trust, hard to know.
Affairs may yet be achieved, but not yet achieved;
The heart may desire speed, but speed is not yet attainable.

---

**Fifteenth Oracle of the Hour of You – Promotion and Emolument May Rise – Most Auspicious**

Heaven and Earth bestow vast favor,
Human and spirit alike revere and admire.
Radiance gathers where virtue dwells,
Look up—blessings arrive.

Heaven and Earth’s grace is abundant—assisting the virtuous, aiding the powerful;
Human and spirit revere—unashamed above, unabashed below.
Emolument and rank advance, celebrating layer upon layer of joy;
Official ranks shift and turn, bowing in admiration to wave upon wave of glory.

A distant message, true and unfeigned, carries no deceit;
Approaching the superior, all receive true favor, blessings shine with grace.

chunks.original_text: 酉时十六　遇事宜进　中平 群鹿在山林，仙花满径春。 正宜时进步，勿更滞空樽。 鹿居山林攸伏濯濯之性，人生俗世贪求戚戚之心。 对仙花之烂熳进步勿迟，逢丽景之融和空樽勿滞。 酉时十七　出萃成用　上上 仙桂发新枝，蟾蜍用正辉。 举金伸我手，谈笑得蟠螭。 手攀仙桂始酬三学之劳，步入蟾官方称十年之志。 展挈云之大手拔萃超群，获龙颔之真珠身荣名贵。 酉时十八　天贵用利　上上 土木着朱衣，相逢意自随。 不妨开一语，扶助上云梯。 至亲者父母兄弟，所倚者君子贵人。 非父母不能生其身，非贵人不能保其禄。 贵人助顺可陆云梯，君子扶持能成美誉。 酉时十九　先进后成　中平 一者是非公，三心意不同。 勿交先下着，胜负在其中。 一事始用或云是而或非，三意不谐或多乖而或多异。 须是先宜速着勿使后时，无令彼在我前恐或迫悔。 酉时二十　谨机用事　中平 各各意难知，机深用最宜。 勿令轻漏泄，必致是成非。 机事不蜜则害身，谋事不谨则累已。 虽同济而干涉各怀意以难度难量，盖所见之异端彼此情而莫达莫晓。 酉时二十一　择机防失　中平 东南路可行，西北恐成述。 用事先达利，切要自安存。 东南春夏乃生旺之吉方所以得朋，西北秋冬乃肃杀之否位所以丧朋。 度其事可以行则行，审其谋当用则用。 酉时二十二　用心必成　上上 欲觅探渊宝，当求颔下珠。 必然成底事，不用自踌蹰。 深渊之宝用智取而必获，龙领之珠当猛求而可得。 心诚坚则可成佛作祖解悟何难，意踌蹰必是败道亏真追悔何益。 酉时二十三　失信绝音　下下 渺渺隔天涯，斜阳噪晚鸦。 空中绝音信，默坐使空嗟。 天涯路渺更无一雁传书，夕照幽庭空听群鸦噪晚。 所谋事如空中捉影岂可而搏，所望事若海内寻针焉能有获。 酉时二十四　先优后喜　上上 缺月又重圆，云开复见天。 醉怀今再醒，败事更成坚。 云开天净一输皎月重圆，忧散喜临往事离而得合。 醉梦醒魂神清净燕处超然，邪魔退道气常存冲和逸乐。 酉时二十五　安固久远　上上 夙怨已除次，新恩来又别。 久久意如何，青松奈霜雪。 施恩惠已消宿怨退祸消殃，布功力而受新恩迎祥集福，青松绿竹傲霜雪而耐岁寒，坚固保安养形神而增禄算。 酉时二十六　福德两助　上上 彩云天外飞，仙音一脉随。 吉祥又喜庆，延福更延禧。 有福者必要有德其福弥高，积善必要积功，其善弥重。 喜祥凝集箫韶仙乐常音，福庆臻华瑞蔼彩云常覆。 酉时二十七　家神不宁　下下 香火一萧疏，家门鬼贼窥。 自当修净洁，方始得安居。 香火精专真有术而神有护，家门喧闹鬼有亏而盗有谋。 正身洁己始有涤於余愆，谢过禳灾方且获於安泰。 酉时二十八　忧事成喜　上上 赢弱复康强，灾殃变吉祥。 小人空计画，大德自昭彰。 重病渐次而愈复尔康强，浮灾迤逦而消再逢喜庆。 阴谋一退如雪影之无综，照朗重明若日光之普鉴。 酉时二十九　如履霜冰　中平 忠良士已成，浸润事何迍。 幸得高人见，闲非已化尘。 忠良之士尚不免於谗言，贤哲之人犹自遭於潜语。 欲止其谤者莫如正己修身，欲戒其非者当以省心改过。 酉时三十　久误方苏　中平 缘木欲求鱼，徒劳志已虚。 分明山下路，咫尺是前途。
chunks.translated_text:
**Sixteenth Oracle of the Hour of You – Advance When the Moment is Right – Neutral**

A herd of deer in the mountain forest,
Immortal blossoms fill the path in spring.
Now is the time to step forward,
Do not linger with an empty cup.

Deer dwell in the mountains, their nature pure and untamed;
In the mundane world, men’s hearts are bound by endless desires.
Facing the radiant bloom of immortal flowers, advance without delay;
Amidst the harmony of a splendid scene, do not idle with an empty cup.

---

**Seventeenth Oracle of the Hour of You – Emerging from Obscurity to Usefulness – Most Auspicious**

The immortal cassia sprouts new branches,
The toad in the moon shines with full radiance.
Raise the golden hand to extend mine,
In laughter and speech, I gain the coiled dragon.

Having grasped the immortal cassia, I repay the toil of threefold study;
Stepping into the lunar palace, I fulfill a decade’s aspiration.
Unfurling the great hand of clouds, I stand out from the crowd;
Obtaining the true pearl from the dragon’s chin, my person is honored and my name esteemed.

---

**Eighteenth Oracle of the Hour of You – Heaven’s Nobility Bestows Favor – Most Auspicious**

Earth and wood don the crimson robe,
Upon meeting, minds follow freely.
Do not hesitate to speak a word,
To aid the ascent up the cloud ladder.

The closest are parents and brothers,
The relied-upon are noble and virtuous men.
Without parents, the body cannot be born;
Without the noble, emolument cannot be secured.
The noble assist in accord with the Dao, enabling ascent up the cloud ladder;
The virtuous lend support, bringing about a fine reputation.

---

**Nineteenth Oracle of the Hour of You – First Advance, Then Success – Neutral**

One matter is judged right or wrong,
Three hearts hold differing intentions.
Do not be the first to yield,
For victory and defeat lie within.

A single affair may be deemed right or wrong;
Three minds may diverge, some in accord, some at odds.
One must act swiftly first, lest the moment pass;
Do not let others precede you, lest regret follow.

---

**Twentieth Oracle of the Hour of You – Caution in Strategy and Action – Neutral**

Each harbors intentions hard to know,
In deep strategy, careful use is most fitting.
Do not let it leak lightly,
Lest what was right become wrong.

If matters of strategy are not kept secret, they harm the self;
If plans are not cautious, they bring trouble upon oneself.
Though united in purpose, each harbors private intentions, hard to measure;
Differing views create barriers, leaving feelings unexpressed and ununderstood.

---

**Twenty-First Oracle of the Hour of You – Choose the Moment, Guard Against Loss – Neutral**

The southeast path may be taken,
The northwest may bring misfortune.
Act when the moment is favorable,
And ensure your own peace and preservation.

The southeast, in spring and summer, is a flourishing direction, bringing allies;
The northwest, in autumn and winter, is a stern and declining quarter, losing them.
Assess the matter—if it can be done, proceed;
Examine the plan—if it should be used, employ it.

---

**Twenty-Second Oracle of the Hour of You – Determination Brings Success – Most Auspicious**

To seek the treasure of the deep abyss,
Seek the pearl beneath the dragon’s chin.
What is destined to be accomplished,
Requires no hesitation.

The treasure of the deep abyss is obtained through wisdom and must be gained;
The pearl beneath the dragon’s chin is won through bold pursuit and can be secured.
With a steadfast heart, one may become a Buddha or an ancestor—what difficulty lies in enlightenment?
With hesitation, one fails the Dao and loses truth—what use is regret?

---

**Twenty-Third Oracle of the Hour of You – Broken Trust, Silence – Most Inauspicious**

Vastly distant, beyond the horizon,
The setting sun, the cawing of crows at dusk.
In the emptiness, all messages cease,
Sitting in silence, one can only sigh.

The path to the horizon stretches, not even a wild goose to carry a letter;
In the secluded courtyard at dusk, only the cawing of crows is heard.
The matter sought is like grasping at shadows in the air—how can it be seized?
The hope cherished is like searching for a needle in the sea—how can it be found?

---

**Twenty-Fourth Oracle of the Hour of You – First Sorrow, Then Joy – Most Auspicious**

The crescent moon becomes full once more,
The clouds part to reveal the sky again.
The drunken heart awakens anew,
What was broken is now made firm.

The clouds disperse, the sky clears, and the moon, once incomplete, is whole again;
Sorrow scatters, joy arrives—what was apart is now united.
The drunken dream fades, the spirit is clear, dwelling in serenity;
Evil retreats, the Dao’s qi remains, harmonious and carefree.

---

**Twenty-Fifth Oracle of the Hour of You – Stability and Longevity – Most Auspicious**

Old grudges have dissolved,
New kindness comes in turn.
How will it be in time?
The green pine endures frost and snow.

Having bestowed kindness, old grudges fade, misfortune departs;
Having rendered service, new favor is received, bringing blessings and fortune.
The green pine and bamboo defy frost and snow, enduring the cold of years;
Firmness and preservation nurture body and spirit, increasing emolument and lifespan.

---

**Twenty-Sixth Oracle of the Hour of You – Blessing and Virtue Both Assist – Most Auspicious**

Colorful clouds fly beyond the heavens,
Immortal music follows in a single thread.
Auspiciousness and joy abound,
Extending fortune and increasing felicity.

Those with blessing must also possess virtue, and their blessing grows ever greater;
Those who accumulate goodness must also accumulate merit, and their goodness deepens.
Joy and auspiciousness gather, the immortal music of *Xiao Shao* ever present;
Fortune and felicity converge, the radiance of propitious clouds ever covering.

---

**Twenty-Seventh Oracle of the Hour of You – Household Spirits Unsettled – Most Inauspicious**

Incense and fire grow sparse,
Ghosts and thieves peer at the household gate.
One must cultivate purity and cleanliness,
Only then may one dwell in peace.

When incense and fire are devoted and true, the spirits offer protection;
When the household is in turmoil, ghosts falter and thieves plot.
Rectify the self and purify the body to cleanse past transgressions;
Acknowledge faults and dispel calamity to attain peace and safety.

---

**Twenty-Eighth Oracle of the Hour of You – Sorrow Turns to Joy – Most Auspicious**

The weak regain strength,
Calamity transforms into good fortune.
Petty men’s schemes come to naught,
Great virtue shines forth.

Serious illness gradually fades, restoring health;
Fleeting misfortune dissipates, bringing joy once more.
Dark schemes retreat like melting snow, leaving no trace;
Brightness shines anew, like the sun’s universal reflection.

---

**Twenty-Ninth Oracle of the Hour of You – Treading on Frost and Ice – Neutral**

The loyal and good are already formed,
Yet slanderous words linger—why the delay?
Fortunately, a noble person sees,
And idle slander turns to dust.

Even the loyal and good are not free from slander;
Even the wise and virtuous may suffer from insinuation.
To silence slander, nothing surpasses self-cultivation;
To correct wrongdoing, one must reflect and reform.

---

**Thirtieth Oracle of the Hour of You – Long Misled, Now Awakened – Neutral**

Climbing a tree to seek fish,
Labor in vain, the aspiration empty.
Clearly, the path lies at the mountain’s foot,
A mere few inches ahead.

Seeking fish by climbing a tree is futile toil;
The road ahead is plainly at the mountain’s base, just a short distance away.

the Hour of You – Promotion and Emolument May Rise – Most Auspicious**

Heaven and Earth bestow vast favor,
Human and spirit alike revere and admire.
Radiance gathers where virtue dwells,
Look up—blessings arrive.

Heaven and Earth’s grace is abundant—assisting the virtuous, aiding the powerful;
Human and spirit revere—unashamed above, unabashed below.
Emolument and rank advance, celebrating layer upon layer of joy;

chunks.original_text: 妄求之欲有如绿木求鱼，越分之谋何异钻冰取火。 当自回心默省今者悟而往者迷，宜交觉念参详醒者清而醉者浊。 戌时第一　徒劳心力　下下 折足鼎何施，安排必见危。 笑他群下口，一事不能为。 鼎之折足不可立立则倾欹，事之亏理不可行行则迍蹇。 倾欹则危而不稳上意乖疏，违蹇则挠而不安下情喧吻。 戌时第二　困中有救　上上 枯木始成用，雪霜多见摧。 一朝春得意，忽尔变芳菲。 积雪严霜之际叶坠林枯，逢迍遇赛之时心灰志懒。 幸阳和布气而着物林茂木荣，得意人提携以扶持困消厄解。 戌时第三　因人借力　上上 车辙有所碍，前途尚见迟。 忽然人着力，举步上云梯。 巨石碍辙虽孟贲亦不能挽其行，猛虎当途纵卞庄亦不敢进而去。 人去石转有轰轰之势，神庇虎行无嫌嫌之忧。 戌时第四　计划无成　下下 梦断魂亦消，悲心起寂寥。 许多良计画，风雨更萧萧， 魂消梦断思百计以无成，虑乱心迷举一谋而不就，对寂寥萧萧夜雨独起悲心，暗咨嗟悄悄西风转生怅恨。 戌时第五　谨身守道　中平 危除过重山，豺狼日共班。 且将低曲折，未可展愁颜。 幽谷深山居处步险心危，豺狼虎豹立身日夜忧惧。 宜谨谨堤防勿纵危中始安，常慊慊和忍常恭忧中变吉。 戌时第六　守静待时　中平 万籁已澄清，月华光彩明。 且将诗酒兴，余事勿关情。 万籁俱息月华朗而宇宙清，百虑皆消魂神静而神体爽。 快遣兴何妨於诗酒物外逍遥。 守真如不碍於讴吟个中快乐。 戌时第七　堤防奸诈　下下 三女事宜防，巧言为乱常。 守心休自纵，牛马退灾祥。 奸人惑正不可测而不可度，伪言乱真必是诡而必是诈。 顺情者不可轻信信则悮人，悦己者必要堤防防则免害。 戌时第八　积功成道　上上 九转灵丹药，功成非一时。 欲求无上道，先下死施为。 功不积者不可以成道，药可炼者方可以成丹。 修行累世名标金简玉籍之中，习业历年身步青云紫霄之上。 戌时第九　脱危成庆　上上 贤达乃真儒，犹同脱钓鱼。 跃开千尺浪，一饵不能拘。 贤达之士不为小利之害身，谷舟之鱼岂可一饵之拘执。 锦鳞脱钓跃踊巨浪之中，君子出灾快进亨途之上。 戌时第十　守正福佑　上上 荡荡乾坤大，巍巍道德尊。 处身当正直，功遇自心存。 乾坤广大善恶报应无私，道德弥高邪正操修皆见。 心正念正福佑自临，心邪念邪吉祥自退。 戌时十一　戒奢防祸　中平 尺水岂能波，量微福戒过。 自前宜撙节，来祸必消磨。 牛泓之水地步浅岂可兴波，窄量之人胸次悭焉能容物。 吉福生於勤俭俭则丰腴，祸败起於淫奢奢则狼籍。 戌时十二　守道勿用　中平 浮华能几何，回首勿蹉跎。 守业休闲纵，狂心勿更波。 浮华易过浑如梦断南柯，盛事难逢谩历时迁岁改。 道业勿令放纵返照回光，安心切戒蹉跎少忧无祸。 戌时十三　所事不谐　下下 水火两相非，小人君子机。 不堪同处乐，去就必难为。 冰炭不同炉盖有相生相克，熏犹不并载盖有相染相污。 君子有宽仁恻隐之心，小人无远识高明之见。 戌时十四　失迷得遇　上上 奔趋路失岐，心怀正此悲。 仙音嘹喨起，方始见光辉。 心迷误则路头蹉跌，意怆惶则举止乖张。 颠危得吉人点悟良言如听仙乐，险阻遇贵人提挈重瞻天日。 戌时十五　遇如不遇　下下
chunks.translated_text:
**First Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Wasted Effort – Most Inauspicious**

Desires of reckless pursuit are like seeking fish from a green tree;
Schemes beyond one’s station differ not from drilling ice for fire.
One must turn inward and reflect in silence—now awakened, while before deluded.
It is fitting to examine awakened thoughts with care—for the sober are clear, while the drunk remain muddled.

---

**Second Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Broken Tripod – Most Inauspicious**

What use is a tripod with broken legs?
All arrangements will surely meet peril.
Mocked by the chatter of inferiors,
Incapable of accomplishing a single task.

A tripod with broken legs cannot stand—once upright, it tilts and topples.
Affairs that defy principle cannot proceed—once attempted, they falter and stall.
Tilting brings danger and instability, estranging the favor of superiors;
Stalling brings frustration and unrest, inciting the clamor of subordinates.

---

**Third Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Salvation in Distress – Most Auspicious**

A withered tree at last finds use,
Though frost and snow have battered it.
One morning, touched by spring’s delight,
It suddenly bursts into fragrant bloom.

Amidst piled snow and bitter frost, leaves fall and forests wither;
In times of hardship and misfortune, the heart grows weary and the will slackens.
Fortunately, the warm breath of spring revives all things—woods flourish and trees thrive;
With the aid of a guiding hand, distress dissolves and calamity is resolved.

---

**Fourth Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Borrowing Strength – Most Auspicious**

A rut blocks the cart’s path,
And the journey ahead seems delayed.
Suddenly, another lends their strength—
A single step ascends the cloud ladder.

A boulder obstructing the rut—even Meng Ben could not drag the cart forward;
A fierce tiger in the way—even Bian Zhuang would not dare advance.
Yet when others remove the stone, the wheels roll with thunderous force;
When the divine shields one’s path, even tigers pose no cause for fear.

---

**Fifth Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Plans Come to Naught – Most Inauspicious**

Dreams shatter, the spirit fades,
And sorrow rises in the stillness.
So many fine schemes devised,
Yet wind and rain howl on, desolate.

The spirit fades as dreams dissolve—hundreds of plans come to nothing;
Thoughts scatter, the mind wanders—not a single strategy bears fruit.
Facing the desolate night rain, sorrow stirs in solitude;
In the hush of the sighing west wind, regret deepens in silence.

---

**Sixth Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Caution and Restraint – Neutral**

Danger dispelled beyond the towering peaks,
Yet jackals and wolves prowl daily.
For now, tread low and winding paths—
Do not yet unfurrow your troubled brow.

Dwelling in deep valleys and perilous mountains, every step is fraught with danger;
Living among jackals and tigers, one must remain vigilant day and night.
It is wise to be cautious and guarded—only then can peril give way to safety;
One must ever be humble and patient—thus may constant worry turn to fortune.

---

**Seventh Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Stillness and Timing – Neutral**

All sounds now hushed, the world serene,
The moon’s radiance shines bright and clear.
Indulge in poetry and wine for joy—
Let all else fade from concern.

All sounds stilled, the moon’s glow illumines a pristine universe;
All worries dissolved, the spirit at rest, the body feels light.
Why not freely pursue delight in poetry and wine, roaming beyond the mundane?
Guard your true nature—what hinders singing of the joy within?

---

**Eighth Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Guard Against Deceit – Most Inauspicious**

Three women demand vigilance,
Their cunning words disrupt all order.
Guard your heart, do not indulge—
Ox and horse may yet avert disaster.

The deceiver’s wiles are unfathomable, their depths unknowable;
False words confound truth—surely they are deceitful, surely they are treacherous.
Those who flatter must not be lightly trusted—trust leads to error;
Those who please must be carefully guarded—vigilance averts harm.

---

**Ninth Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Accumulating Merit to Attain the Dao – Most Auspicious**

The elixir of nine refinements,
Its power perfected not in a single moment.
To seek the supreme Dao,
First devote yourself to selfless action.

Without accumulated merit, the Dao cannot be attained;
Only through repeated refinement can the elixir be achieved.
Cultivating practice over lifetimes, one’s name is inscribed in golden registers and jade tablets;
Pursuing study through the years, the body ascends to the azure clouds and purple mists.

---

**Tenth Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Escaping Peril to Joy – Most Auspicious**

The worthy and enlightened are true scholars,
Like fish that slip free from the hook.
Leaping through waves a thousand feet high,
A single bait cannot hold them.

The worthy and enlightened do not fall prey to petty gains that harm the self;
How can a fish in a valley stream be ensnared by a single bait?
The golden-scaled fish escapes the hook, leaping in the mighty waves;
The noble one emerges from calamity, swiftly advancing on the path of prosperity.

---

**Eleventh Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Uprightness Brings Blessing – Most Auspicious**

Vast and boundless, the heavens and earth,
Majestic and revered, virtue and power.
To conduct oneself with integrity—
Fortune and favor reside within the heart.

Heaven and earth are vast—good and evil meet their just reward without partiality;
Virtue and power are lofty—uprightness and perversity are revealed through cultivation.
With a heart and thoughts aligned in rectitude, blessings naturally descend;
With a heart and thoughts steeped in perversity, good fortune naturally recedes.

---

**Twelfth Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Caution Against Extravagance – Neutral**

How can shallow waters stir great waves?
A meager capacity must guard against excess.
From this moment, practice restraint—
Thus may coming misfortune be worn away.

A mere puddle—how can it generate waves?
A narrow-minded person—how can their heart hold generosity?
Good fortune arises from diligence and frugality—frugality brings abundance;
Calamity stems from indulgence and extravagance—extravagance leads to ruin.

---

**Thirteenth Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Upholding the Dao Without Force – Neutral**

How long can fleeting splendor last?
Turn back—do not let time slip idly by.
Guard your enterprise, do not neglect it;
Restrain the reckless heart, let it know no waves.

Fleeting splendor passes like a dream in the southern branch;
Grand affairs are rare—time drifts, and the years change.
Do not let the Dao’s work lapse—turn inward and reflect;
Calm the mind, beware of idleness—few worries bring no misfortune.

---

**Fourteenth Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Discord in Affairs – Most Inauspicious**

Water and fire cannot coexist,
As the mechanisms of petty men and noble ones differ.
They cannot share joy in harmony—
Parting or staying will surely prove difficult.

Ice and charcoal cannot share a furnace—they are bound by mutual generation and restraint;
Fragrance and stench cannot ride the same carriage—they are bound by mutual contamination and defilement.
The noble one possesses a heart of compassion and mercy;
The petty man lacks foresight and lofty vision.

---

**Fifteenth Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Lost Yet Found – Most Auspicious**

Rushing forward, the path is lost at the fork,
The heart heavy with sorrow.
Then, a celestial melody rings clear—
Only now does the radiance appear.

When the mind is lost, one stumbles at the crossroads;
When the spirit is distraught, actions become erratic.
In peril, a kind soul offers enlightenment—words of wisdom like celestial music;
In adversity, a noble person lends aid—once more, the light of day is seen.

---

**Sixteenth Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Encountered Yet Unmet – Most Inauspicious**

---

**Thirtieth Oracle of the Hour of You – Long Misled, Now Awakened – Neutral**

Climbing a tree to seek fish,
Labor in vain, the aspiration empty.
Clearly, the path lies at the mountain’s foot,
A mere few inches ahead.

Seeking fish by climbing a tree is futile toil;
The road ahead is plainly at the mountain’s base, just a short distance away.

chunks.original_text: 万宝积如山，行人不遇还。 空将心智术，一笑梦魂间。 人不积善如入宝山空手回，道既寡缘得遇真仙无眼识。 机会临而失搓智术空谈，好事遇而乖差营谋无用。 戌时十六　忧事未解　下下 骑虎势难下，随机旋旋行。 一朝能脱洒，快我志平生。 登险崖心不可逸逸则害己，骑猛兽势不容下下则噬人。 正此忧怀宜且谦恭而待物，次须脱洒始知散虑以逍遥。 戌时十七　用事未达　下下 薄雾作浓阴，天昏未得明。 行人空叹息，去路尚多程。 浓阴作晦不知昏晓之天，索手登程忽陷沉迷之泽。 谋未达去程多阻水隔烟村，人尚阻味况不苏云遮陇陌。 戌时十八　离事重遇　上上 一别几经年，相逢事偶然。 重开樽俎兴，欢笑再绵绵。 故人惜别相逢樽俎之欢，宝月当亏复有团圆之意。 事际遇易知返掌笑逐颜开，时通泰顺若推轮喜从天降。 戌时十九　用事再三　中平 三谒方能遇，一言那便回。 再三行底事，方得笑颜开。 扣关三谒不辞往复之劳，事非一言岂便无从之许。 虽再三而至恳终必有成，当守一而至勤事无不就。 戌时二十　信息临喜　上上 云中鸦阵飞，信息始重知。 坐待回音至，行人咫尺归。 雁足传书喜得云中之美信，鱼腹尺素欣逢水内之佳音。 坐待者归期之不远，咫尺者旦夕而可临。 戌时二十一　出幽得遇　上上 宝赦降天来，幽关钻自开。 释他愆与衅，更赐利名回。 赦自天来释其愆而宥其过，福由真降保其命以延其生。 幽关破而拔萃超升，恩光临而标名赐禄。 戌时二十二　遇人知己　上上 宝玉久沉埋，光芒射斗回。 有人能鉴识，幽现上仙台。 麒骥困於盐车非百乐而不可识，美玉藏於顽石非卞和而不能知。 遇知己之士可以显拔其身，逢高上之士可以晓明其道。 戌时二十三　妄语虚信　下下 妄语多言道，虚无非实情。 传闻空挂记，终是不分明。 一人妄语，众人妄传。 妄说者将无作有以假乱於至真，妄传者反是为非以言惑於众听。 戌时二十四　遇时得达　中平 百卉正芳菲，春花烂熳时，东君能着物，何虑事留迟。 物不遇春则不能发萌吐秀，人不遇时则不能展志舒情。 时之至也东君有着物之荣，命之通也廊庙有陶镕之赐。 戌时二十五　亨通无碍　上上 改革得从新，江山丽日明。 目前无限景，啸傲乐平生。 斗柄回寅革固鼎新之象，春光着物花芳柳袅之时。 目前有景明媚则笑傲何妨，心下忧闷顿除则熙游何碍。 戌时二十六　成名得禄　上上 拂拭更无尘，衣冠学业新。 始能通大道，必不负青云。 灵台拂拭更无一点之尘埃，学业绝伦必取三元之魁首。 衣冠正钦仰尊崇之礼貌，功业就获取甲第之超荣。 戌时二十七　不可合成　一下 顽石休将琢，枯杨不可栽。 小人无大器，往事岂能回。 器量小者不可以任大，智识低者不可以谈高。 顽石无玉琢磨徒费於工夫，枯木无根栽植谩劳於浇灌。 戌时二十八　忧事自散　中平 绵绵虑未休，岂可见踪由。 须待经时序，忧波逐水流。 淹延不决者谓之虑，祸患恐临者谓之忧。 虑渐解如暴风扫云，忧自消若游波逐水。 戌时二十九　鬼忧心虑　下下 夜雨泣幽窗，风寒雨又狂。 不能成一寐，余事更堪伤。 幽窗鬼泣虑邪崇侵扰於家门，永夜风寒恐疾厄牵缠於阴小。 事纷乱则梦寐不安，意伤悲则行藏不泰。
chunks.translated_text:
**Sixteenth Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Wealth Piled Like Mountains – Most Inauspicious**

A mountain of treasures stands before you,
Yet the traveler departs empty-handed.
Wisdom and skill are but vain exertions—
A fleeting laugh between dream and soul.

One who fails to accumulate goodness enters the treasure mountain and leaves with empty hands;
The Dao is scarce in affinity—even if one meets a true immortal, there are no eyes to recognize them.
Opportunity arrives, yet through hesitation and misjudgment, all schemes and strategies come to naught;
Good fortune presents itself, yet through discord and misstep, all plans and efforts prove useless.

---

**Seventeenth Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Troubles Unresolved – Most Inauspicious**

Riding a tiger, dismounting is perilous—
One must follow the moment, circling endlessly.
Yet should the day come when freedom is won,
How joyous the fulfillment of my lifelong resolve!

Ascending a perilous cliff, the heart must not grow careless—carelessness brings harm to oneself;
Riding a fierce beast, one cannot dismount—dismounting invites devouring.
In this time of worry, it is best to remain humble and reverent, awaiting the turn of events;
Only when one attains liberation may one truly know the ease of casting aside concerns and wandering freely.

---

**Eighteenth Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Affairs Hindered – Most Inauspicious**

Thin mist gathers into dense gloom,
The sky darkens, and clarity eludes.
The traveler sighs in vain—
The road ahead remains long.

Thick gloom obscures the sky, leaving no distinction between dusk and dawn;
Setting forth empty-handed, one suddenly falls into a mire of confusion.
Plans unfulfilled, the journey ahead is fraught with obstacles—water divides villages, and mist veils the paths;
People remain obstructed, and even more so when awakening is hindered—clouds shroud the fields and trails.

---

**Nineteenth Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Reunion After Parting – Most Auspicious**

Years have passed since we last parted,
Our reunion now a chance encounter.
Once more, the feast is laid, and cups are raised—
Laughter and joy intertwine anew.

An old friend, cherished in parting, is met again with the joy of shared cups and plates;
The precious moon, though once waning, holds the promise of reunion.
Matters of fate are as easily turned as the palm—smiles bloom, and faces brighten;
Times of prosperity and peace are like a wheel rolling forward—joy descends as if from heaven.

---

**Twentieth Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Persistence in Affairs – Neutral**

Three visits are needed before the meeting,
A single word will not suffice to turn away.
Only after repeated efforts
Does the smile of success appear.

Knocking at the gate thrice, one does not shirk the toil of coming and going;
If matters could be settled with a single word, how could there be no room for consent?
Though persistence may require repeated attempts, sincerity will ultimately bear fruit;
By steadfastly holding to one course with diligence, no task will remain unaccomplished.

---

**Twenty-First Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Tidings of Joy – Most Auspicious**

A flock of crows flies through the clouds—
Only now is the message known.
Seated, one awaits the return of the reply,
And the traveler is but a short distance away.

A wild goose’s foot bears a letter—joy comes with the beautiful tidings from the clouds;
A fish’s belly carries a note—happiness arrives with the fine news from the waters.
For the one seated in wait, the return is not far off;
For the one but a short distance away, the reunion is but a day or night away.

---

**Twenty-Second Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Emerging from Darkness – Most Auspicious**

A precious amnesty descends from heaven,
And the gates of darkness open of their own accord.
Transgressions and offenses are absolved,
And favor, rank, and fortune are bestowed anew.

An amnesty descends from heaven, releasing faults and pardoning errors;
Fortune flows from the true Dao, preserving life and extending destiny.
The gates of darkness are broken, and one is elevated beyond the common;
The light of grace shines upon them, and their name is inscribed with rank and emolument.

---

**Twenty-Third Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Meeting a True Friend – Most Auspicious**

A treasure long buried in the earth,
Its radiance now pierces the stars.
One who can recognize its worth
Will ascend the terrace of the immortals.

A qilin is trapped pulling a salt cart—without Bo Le, it cannot be known;
A beautiful jade is hidden in rough stone—without Bian He, it cannot be discerned.
Meeting a true friend, one’s talents may be revealed and their person elevated;
Encountering a lofty sage, one’s Dao may be illuminated and made clear.

---

**Twenty-Fourth Oracle of the Hour of Xu – False Words and Empty Trust – Most Inauspicious**

False words and idle speech abound,
Vain and devoid of truth.
Rumors spread, yet nothing is certain—
All remains unclear in the end.

One speaks falsely, and many repeat the falsehood.
The fabricator turns nothing into something, disrupting truth with deception;
The transmitter inverts right and wrong, misleading the ears of the multitude.

---

**Twenty-Fifth Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Seizing the Moment – Neutral**

A hundred blossoms bloom in fragrant splendor,
The spring flowers in full, resplendent display.
The Lord of Spring bestows his touch—
Why fear delay in affairs?

Plants that do not meet spring cannot sprout or bloom;
People who do not meet their time cannot unfold their aspirations or express their feelings.
When the season arrives, the Lord of Spring adorns all things with glory;
When fate flows smoothly, the halls of state bestow their molding grace.

---

**Twenty-Sixth Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Unobstructed Success – Most Auspicious**

Reform brings renewal,
The rivers and mountains shine under a bright sun.
Before one’s eyes, boundless vistas unfold—
A life of carefree joy and contentment.

The Dipper’s handle turns to *yin*, heralding the renewal of the tripod;
Spring’s light graces all things, a time of fragrant flowers and swaying willows.
With the world before one’s eyes radiant and clear, why not laugh and wander freely?
When the weight of worry is suddenly lifted, what hinders joyful roaming?

---

**Twenty-Seventh Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Attaining Rank and Emolument – Most Auspicious**

Dust is swept away without a trace,
Robes and cap, learning and conduct—all made new.
Only then can the great Dao be attained,
And the blue clouds will not be betrayed.

The sacred terrace is swept clean, not a speck of dust remains;
Learning surpasses all others, and one is certain to claim the highest honors.
Robes and cap command respect and reverence;
Achievements are fulfilled, and one attains the supreme glory of the imperial examinations.

---

**Twenty-Eighth Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Incompatibility – Most Inauspicious**

Do not attempt to carve unyielding stone,
Nor plant a withered willow.
The petty lack great capacity—
What is past cannot be undone.

One of small capacity cannot bear great responsibility;
One of low wisdom cannot discourse on lofty matters.
Unyielding stone cannot be carved into jade—efforts are wasted;
Withered wood cannot take root—watering and tending are in vain.

---

**Twenty-Ninth Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Worries Dissipate – Neutral**

Endless worries linger,
Yet no trace or cause is seen.
One must await the turning of the seasons—
Anxieties will flow away like water.

Prolonged indecision is called worry;
Fear of impending misfortune is called anxiety.
Worries dissolve like clouds scattered by a violent wind;
Anxieties vanish like waves carried away by the current.

---

**Thirtieth Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Ghostly Worries and Anxieties – Most Inauspicious**

Night rain weeps at the secluded window,
Wind and cold, the rain lashes fiercely.
Sleep eludes, and one cannot rest—
Other sorrows weigh even heavier.

At the secluded window, ghosts weep—malevolent spirits invade the household;
Through the long night, wind and cold—illness and misfortune cling to the young and weak.
When affairs are in disarray, sleep is restless;
When the heart is grieved, actions are troubled.

chunks.original_text: 戌时三十　前程通达　上上 鸾鹤两逍遥，风清月更高。 仙人相指引，霄汉路迢迢。 造物纯粹更无赛剥之忧，功行圆成必有仙真之遇。 鸾鹄升举逍遥於云汉之中，风月朗清澄澈於乾坤之内。 亥时第一　守道得真　上上 妙语不可得，真仙岂易逢。 一心能信恪，八达自亨通。 志言逆耳不巧者谓之忠，巧言美听不中者谓之巧。 一心恪信道可就而功可成，八达开通仙可学而真可遇。 亥时第二　出滞升达　上上 举翼升乔木，飞腾得意时。 乘风方借力，一跃到天池。 出於幽谷迁於乔大升腾得志之秋，失之东隅得之桑榆灵贶亨嘉之际。 跃天池於万里，因风肋於一时。 亥时第三　引获迷误　上上 流水碧溪长，桃源路渺茫。 若非人指引，岂得遇真光。 心着想者谓之迷，意差谬者谓之误。 流水碧溪访桃源而有路迷途渐通，倒乱颠危求妙理以知归误心复醒。 亥时第四　力心任大　下下 萤火竞月华，小大意何差。 费却精神力，终为一笑夸。 一叶小舟不载万钧之重，一泓浅水焉兴百尺之波。 智识愚昧已非廊庙之贤才，道行疏慵未有神仙之骨格。 亥时第五　无助无望　下下 不学不知道，不修不遇真，工夫无一点，徒自作空名。 功行两全乃有达道升仙之分，学业俱美岂无科甲及第之荣。 既德行学业之不修，望富贵功名而差远。 亥时第六　现出明暗　上上 古镜久昏昏，光辉尚未闻。 一朝人拂拭，妍丑自能分。 昏埃积於宝鉴得洗磨则光莹复生，淹滞出於善良遇提携则精神始怿。 鉴莹净则可以照物，命通达则可以成名。 亥时第七　神真护佑　上上 香霭上丹霄，诚心一念遥。 举行无不利，神物自昭昭。 宝炉焚篆诚心达上於丹霄，净室延真举意永无於欺谄。 举一事自天佑之吉无不利，谋一用唯神所护福有所归。 亥时第八　灾退病除　中平 鬼散病已痊，愁颜变笑颜。 诚心答天地，更勿造诸愆。 凶方鬼散因道力以驱除，幽室病消乃真光而护佑。 恭敬虔诚於香火众善奉行，消禳伸谢於愆尤诸恶莫作。 亥时第九　除小不宁　下下 缺月未圆时，家人独掩扉。 未能伸屈曲，阴小虑防危。 月缺亏光家人生重重之危厄，花残凋落阴小有迭迭之迍邅。 自身有暗昧屈曲之忧，门户招唇吻是非之恼。 亥时第十　口舌不宁　下下 泣泣更沉沉，门阑非妄临。 守静方能吉，免使祸来侵。 沉昤少语胸中有郁结之愁，唇吻多端户内惹忧虞之事。 口舌争於争竞隐忍为先，妄动起於不宁守静为上。 亥时十一　得时遇便　上上 舟行趁便风，众志一心同。

**Thirtieth Oracle of the Hour of Xu – Path Ahead Unobstructed – Most Auspicious**

Phoenix and crane roam free in leisure,
Wind pure, moon high above.
An immortal points the way—
The celestial path stretches far and wide.

Creation’s essence is flawless, free from harm or decay;
Cultivation perfected, one is sure to meet a true immortal.
Phoenix and crane ascend, soaring through the clouds;
Wind and moon shine clear, illuminating heaven and earth.

---

**First Oracle of the Hour of Hai – Upholding the Dao to Attain Truth – Most Auspicious**

Profound words are not easily grasped,
True immortals are seldom encountered.
With wholehearted devotion and reverence,
All eight directions open smoothly.

Words harsh to the ear, unadorned, are called loyalty;
Sweet, pleasing speech that misses the mark is called cunning.
Devotion to the Dao brings completion of merit;
The eight paths open, immortality may be learned, truth may be met.

---

**Second Oracle of the Hour of Hai – Breaking Free to Ascend – Most Auspicious**

Wings spread to rise to the lofty tree,
Soaring in triumphant flight.
Riding the wind, borrowing its force,
One leaps to the celestial pond.

Emerging from the dark valley to the towering heights—
A time of ascent and fulfillment.
Losing at dawn, gaining by dusk—
A moment of divine favor and joy.
Leaping to the celestial pond across ten thousand miles,
Riding the wind’s aid in an instant.

---

**Third Oracle of the Hour of Hai – Guidance to Avoid Delusion – Most Auspicious**

The emerald stream flows long,
The path to Peach Blossom Spring is distant and faint.
Without another’s guidance,
How could one encounter true light?

Clinging to thoughts is called delusion;
Deviant intentions are called error.
Following the emerald stream to Peach Blossom Spring—
The lost path gradually clears.
Inverted and perilous, seeking the profound—
Knowing the return, the misguided heart awakens.

---

**Fourth Oracle of the Hour of Hai – Overreaching Ambition – Most Inauspicious**

Firefly vies with moonlight,
How vast the difference in scale!
Wasting spirit and strength,
Only to be mocked in the end.

A single leaf of a boat cannot bear the weight of ten thousand jun;
A shallow pool cannot stir waves a hundred feet high.
Wisdom and insight dull, unfit for the court’s halls;
Daoist practice lax, lacking the bone-structure of immortals.

---

**Fifth Oracle of the Hour of Hai – No Aid, No Hope – Most Inauspicious**

Without study, the Dao remains unknown;
Without cultivation, truth is not met.
Not a trace of effort—
Only an empty name in vain.

Merit and cultivation complete, one may ascend the Dao and attain immortality;
Learning and conduct refined, how could official rank and glory be absent?
Yet with neither virtue nor learning cultivated,
Hopes for wealth, honor, and fame are far off indeed.

---

**Sixth Oracle of the Hour of Hai – Clarity Emerges from Obscurity – Most Auspicious**

An ancient mirror, long dimmed,
Its radiance unheard of.
Once polished by another’s hand,
Beauty and ugliness stand revealed.

Dust and grime accumulate on the precious mirror—
Washed and polished, its brilliance revives.
Stagnation lifts from the good and kind—
With guidance, their spirit rejoices.
The mirror gleams pure, reflecting all things;
Destiny flows smoothly, names are made.

---

**Seventh Oracle of the Hour of Hai – Divine Protection – Most Auspicious**

Incense smoke ascends to the cinnabar heavens,
A single sincere thought reaches afar.
Every action brings success—
The divine presence shines clearly.

The treasure censer burns talismans, sincerity rises to the cinnabar heavens;
The pure chamber invites the true, intent remains free of deceit.
Every endeavor is blessed by heaven—none fail;
Every plan is guarded by the divine—fortune finds its home.

---

**Eighth Oracle of the Hour of Hai – Disaster Retreats, Illness Fades – Neutral**

Ghosts disperse, illness heals,
Sorrowful faces turn to smiles.
With sincerity, one answers heaven and earth—
Take care not to create new transgressions.

Malevolent spirits scatter, driven away by the power of the Dao;
Illness fades from the secluded chamber, shielded by true light.
Reverent and devout in offerings and good deeds,
Expiate misfortunes, give thanks—
Avoid wrongdoing, forsake all evil.

---

**Ninth Oracle of the Hour of Hai – Minor Troubles Unsettled – Most Inauspicious**

The moon wanes, not yet full,
A lone figure shuts the door.
Unable to straighten what is bent,
The young and weak fear peril.

The moon’s light wanes—
The household faces layer upon layer of danger.
Flowers wither and fall—
The young and weak meet repeated misfortune.
The self harbors hidden, crooked worries;
The household invites gossip, strife, and vexation.

---

**Tenth Oracle of the Hour of Hai – Discord and Strife – Most Inauspicious**

Tears fall, deeper and deeper,
Unfounded troubles press at the gate.
Only stillness brings fortune—
Avoid inviting calamity.

Murmurs and silence—
The heart holds pent-up sorrow.
Lips and tongues wag—
The household stirs with anxiety.
Strife arises from contention—
Restraint comes first.
Restlessness from disturbance—
Stillness is supreme.

---

**Eleventh Oracle of the Hour of Hai – Seizing Opportunity – Most Auspicious**

The boat sails with the favorable wind,
Many hearts united as one.

When the heart is grieved, actions are troubled.

chunks.original_text: 正遇良佳节，花开满目中。 得时用事逢良便易若推轮，下水行舟遇顺风速如奔骑。 对良辰兴佳节柳绽花开，会故友与新朋心同意合。 亥时十二　乐极生悲　下下 樽空兴已空，心事正迷蒙，本是逍遥客，翻居滞碍中。 欢娱奢侈财空兴竭成忧，故纵贵婪罪极过探生祸。 本是逍遥之客强起悲颜，幸为快乐之人返求拘执。 亥时十三　迷误得省　中平 怀抱不堪言，呻吟虑最先。 有人明语决，醉醒觉轻便。 性迷则执见不通，心解则通达易悟。 得人奇语如惠百镒之良金； 快我心怀似饮一杯之酥酪。 亥时十四　谋望无定　下下 意若云中鸦，心如水上萍。 狂踪无定迹，妙用岂能成。 云鹤飞空之物准拟难凭，萍梗泛水之踪聚财不足。 所谋者必无望徒起所谋，所用者必无成谩劳於用。 亥时十五　望用必迍　下下 十言方成计，虑事必先明。 不可轻轻举，终为一笑声。 阴谋执诈者谓之奸，料度奇中者谓之策。 策不当而计不用返受余殃，事不审而谋不成徒为人哂。 亥时十六　先到后成　中平 折翼下丹霄，冲天一忌已消。 更须宜养锐，再举不为劳。 乌折翼则挫奋飞翱翔之锐，人失志则生退惭悔懒之心。 羽毛再整岂无霄汉之冲，志业重修必有亨途之望。 亥时十七　失则绾事　下下 倚恃必须失，托人终见危。 虚将财与利，空惹是和非。 协公倚势如倚冰山，太肠一照而冰解山摧。 轻信托人如搏云雾暴风忽至，而雾散云飞财利俱亡交争并至。 亥时十八　不可成事　下下 盲者不能行，失音那有声。 既盲并且哑，事语两无成。 所谋不遂如瞽者视毫末之微，所望无成若疮者起讽吟之韵。 既言视不能明咦则动用焉得遂通。 亥时十九　遇贵成事　上上 森森古木高，梁栋用非遥。 待时逢良匠，知音契合招。 端森之木良匠择而为栋为梁，忠贤之士天官选而有权有禄。 材高名重则知音自遇，学广德深而契鉴须逢。 亥时二十　遇时得济　上上 月到中秋夜，花逢二月春。 此时当庆赏，百福尽维新。 中秋夜月一输桂影团圆，二月阳春万卉芳葩锦绣。 庆佳辰而宴集百福临门，对良夜而清欢千祥萃户。 亥时二十一　失时少遇　下下 中秋风雨后，月暗不成辉。 独坐空庭裹，无言竟自悲。 风雨障中秋之月不绪蟾光，迍蒙挫寒士之心惟逢蹇塞。 守空庭而独处默默无言，居冗舍而失时沉沉有恨。 亥时二十二　改过得安　中平 逼迫上高山，行人举步难。 若能平正道，不可用机关。 为人岂得无过知其过则改过以自新，谋事岂得不难经其难对先难而后易。 守正道者自安其分，甩机关者自挠其必。 亥时二十三　忧事未宁　下下 虎逐群羊急，风飘败叶狂。 静中犹未得，那得望成章。 仓惶失措如猛虎而逐群羊，斯倒乱惊似急风而飘败叶。 心欲静而未静余事尚牵，意欲宁而未宁外情内扰。 亥时二十四　寡助少成　下下 渡口无舟楫，陆行车挫轮。 不能相接济，只力尚前奔。 非舟楫不能以济渡，非轮毂不可以行车。 寡助之情临渡口而沉迷舟楫，无成之意登平陆而挫折输挽。 亥时二十五　先忧后喜　上上 暴雨何来速，雷霆忽起惊，一时天意助，月朗气澄清。 暴雨急风桃李有摧残之意，轰雷掣电鱼龙有震悚之惊。 风一静则月朗气清，云一收则花红柳绿。 亥时二十六　功成道合　上上
